loans.use: to purchase more cassava fish and Bonnie fish to enlarge her business

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu is 49 years old. She lives in the Airport community. She stopped her education in 9th grade, and she is married and has children aged between 22 and 36 years old. One is living with her and going to school. For the past fifteen years Lorpu has been selling rice, oil, charcoal, and plastic bags. The problem that she faces is a shortage of goods. Lorpu likes her business because it provides for her. Her husband also sells along with her. Lorpu is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, charcoal and plastic bags for her business. Her plans are to send her children to school and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, charcoal and plastic bags for her business

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu lives in the Airport Community. She is 30 years old, married,  and has three children between the ages of 9 and 16 years old. All her children are in school and live at home.  For the past 10 years she has been selling rice, pepper, and  oil. The rainy season poses a problem for her.

Fatu is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, pepper, onions, and other items for her business. She likes her business and the way people respond to it. Her plans are to become an international businesswoman and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, pepper, onions, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Olga María

texts.es:
La Señora Olga es socia del banco comunal Atenas del Ecuador, vive por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos, los mismos que le dan el nombra Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde 1999 por su belleza arquitectónica y la cultura de su gente.
 
La Señora. Olga tiene 51 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas es casada y vive independiente, sus 4 hijos trabajan y ayudan económicamente y dos de ellos estudian en la universidad y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en un taxi que es de su propiedad.

Doña Olga tiene una abacería donde vende varios productos como: aceite, vinagre, granos secos, bacalao, etc. también vende productos de bazar, tiene este negocio hace 4 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 12 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para seguir construyendo su casa.

Sus metas son terminar su casa, sacar adelante a sus hijos y no tener deudas siendo este su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the communal bank Atenas del Ecuador. She lives in the area of Orquídeas in the city of Cuena. This city is surrounded by four rivers which give it the name Santa Ana de los Cuatro Rios. It's been a World Heritage Site since 1999 due to its beautiful architecture and its people's culture.

Olga is 51 years old, married, and from her marital union has conceived six children who are all of legal age. One of her daughters is married and lives independently. Her other four children work and help financially, and two of them study in college. Her youngest son studies at a high school in the city. Her husband is a driver and works offering his services by means of a taxi which is his property.

Mrs. Olga has a small grocery store where she sells various products like: oil, vinegar, dry grains, cod, etc. She also sells stationary products. She's had this business for four years and works from Sunday to Sunday without a set schedule.

She's been a member of the communal bank for twelve years and will invest her new loan in the purchase of construction materials in order to continue constructing her home.

Her goal is to complete her home, get her children ahead, and to not have any debt, the last being her greatest dream.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 42 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 13 years old. All of them are attending school and live at home. For the past 7 years she has been running a (restaurant) in the market. A problem she faces is the shortage of goods. 

Betty is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, and oil for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora lives in Buchanan. She is 44 years old and married with seven children, ages 15 to 25, who live at home. For the past fifteen years, she has been selling slippers, tubs, and palm oil in the local market. She established the business with small loans from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and blouses to expand her business. In the future she wants to build a house  and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and blouses to expand her business

loans.name: Tonia

texts.en: Tonia, 42 years old,  lives in Buchanan. She is married and has seven children aged 23 to 35, all living at home. For the past fifteen years, Tonia has been selling slippers and palm oil in the local market. She established the business with small loans from her mother. Tonia is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and palm oil to expand her business. In the future she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Inés Jacqueline

texts.es:
La Señora. Inés es socia del banco comunal Atenas del Ecuador, vive por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos, los mismos que le dan el nombra Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde 1999 por su belleza arquitectónica y la cultura de su gente. 

La Señora. Inés tiene 43 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos  de 20 y 12 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo labora como mecánico industrial, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Inés se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, cría y vende cerdos, cuyes y pollos, también hace dos meses se dedica a limpiar oficinas y trabaja de lunes a viernes.
 
Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y pollos.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the communal bank Atenas del Ecuador. She lives in the area of Orquídeas in the city of Cuena. This city is surrounded by four rivers which give it the name Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos. It's been a World Heritage Site since 1999 due to its beautiful architecture and its people's culture.

Inés is 43 years old, married, and from her marital union has conceived two children who are 20 and 12 years old. Her first son works and helps financially and her second daughter is studying at a high school in the city. Her husband works as an industrial mechanic and the home in which they live is their property.

Mrs. Inés makes a living doing household chores, raising and selling pigs, guinea pigs, and chicken, and has also been cleaning offices for two months, working from Monday to Friday.

This is the third loan she will have with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of pigs and chicken.

Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chicken.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 47 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a social worker. They have three children between the ages of 9 and 18 years old. All of the children are attending school and live at home. 

For the past 10 years, Martha has been selling cosmetics in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. She plans to be a successful businesswoman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 36 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and she has five  children between the ages of 4 and 15. All  of them are attending school and live at home. For the past nine years she has been selling plastic dishes (cups, plates, and bowls) in the local market. She started this business with help from her mother.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more plastic dishes (cups, plates, and bowls) for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic dishes (cups, plates, and bowls) for her business

loans.name: Sundayway

texts.en:
Sundayway is 24 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a social worker. They have two children 2 and 4 years old. One of them is attending school and they both live at home. 

For the past five years Sundayway has been selling used clothes  in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes  for her business. She plans to be a big business woman in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes  for her business

loans.name: Cumanda Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Cumandá es socia del banco comunal Atenas del Ecuador, vive por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos, los mismos que le dan el nombra Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad desde 1999 por su belleza arquitectónica y la cultura de su gente. 

Doña Cumandá tiene 31 años, es casada y en su unión  conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 11, 7 y 4 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su papá de manera independiente.

La Señora. Cumandá es Odontóloga y está poniendo un consultorio dental. También hace 7 meses se dedica a la venta de productos de plástico de la marca Tooperweer.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realizan en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar materiales Odontológicos.

Su meta es realizar un masterado de su profesión.
texts.en:
Cumandá is a member of the communal bank Atenas del Ecuador. She lives in the area of Orquídeas in the city of Cuena. This city is surrounded by four rivers which give it the name Santa Ana de los Cuatro Ríos. It's been a World Heritage Site since 1999 due to its beautiful architecture and its people's culture.

Mrs. Cumandá is 31 years old, married, and from her marital union has conceived three children who are 11, 7, and 4 years old. Her first two children study at an elementary school in the city. Her husband is a driver and works driving a truck. They don't have their own home due to which they live in her father's home in an independent fashion.

Cumandá is a dentist and is already starting a dental practice. She has also been making a living selling Tooperweer brand name plastic products for seven months.

This is the first loan they are executing with the communal bank to which she was invited by a female friend. She is going to invest her loan in the purchase of dental materials.

Her goal is to do a masters in her profession.

loans.use: to buy dental materials.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y 5 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor este año empezó la escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual tiene un tanquero con  el cual surte de agua a ciertas empresas y fabricas en la ciudad de Manta, nos cuenta  que su esposo realiza varios viajes al dia ya que es estos lugares requieren mucho de este liquido vital para poder trabajar, él recibe el pago semanal por la venta del agua por lo cual requiere de capital para seguir trabajando, él lleva más de 14 años dedicado a esta labor la cual les ha permitido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar agua y  combustibles para seguir trabajando. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y fácil de pagar.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its diversity of local products such as Panama hats known within and outside of the country, the members of the communal bank Mujeres Por el Progreso meet every 15 days.

Here we meet Ana, who is 43 years old, married and with 2 children with her partner. Her oldest, 15 years old, studies at school and the younger one, 5 years old, just began school this year. Her husband is a driver. 

Our friend is using the loan for her husband who has a tanker truck with which he takes water to businesses and factories in the city of Manta. She tells us that her husband makes several trips each day because these places require a lot of this vital liquid in order to work. He receives weekly pay for the sell of water and needs capital in order to continue working. He has made a living in this work for more than 14 years, which he has used to get ahead. 

This loan is to buy water and fuel to continue working. She has had four cycles with the communal bank and likes it because the loans are fast and easy to pay.

Her dreams are to get ahead and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy water and fuel.

loans.name: Shirley Rosana

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Shirley tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 11 y 6 años de edad, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio de Jaramijo.

Nuestra amiga tiene un cibercafé y cabinas telefónicas en su casa, en el cual ofrece servicios de internet y llamadas telefónicas, también en su local vende helados, sodas jugos, golosinas, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas de todas las operadoras, allí trabaja todos los días desde hace tres años que tiene su negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien ya que no hay muchos negocios como el suyo por donde ella vive.

Este crédito es para comprar golosinas y pagar el servicio de internet y teléfono. Esta desde hace 1 año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its diversity of local products such as Panama hats and shawls known inside and outside the country, the members of the communal bank Mujeres Por el Progreso meet every fifteen days.

Here we meet Shirley who is 34 years old, married and with three children. The two oldest study at school and are 13 and 11 years old. Her youngest is 6 years old and is in primary school. Her husband works in the Municipality of Jaramijo. 

Our friend has a cybercafe and phone booths in her house, in which she offers internet service and phone calls. She also sells ice cream, sodas, juices, candy, telephone cards and pay as you go recharges for all telephone companies. She works there every day for the past three years that she has had her business. She tells us that it's going very well for her because there are not many businesses like hers where she lives. 

This credit is to buy candy and pay the internet and telephone bills. She has been a part of the communal bank for one year and likes it because the group is very united. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy candy and to pay her internet and telephone bills.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Pon is 37 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 per day. One of her children is a garment worker and earns about $3 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pon is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help reduce the transportation expenses and help her go to work on time. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business to become a construction foreman and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Rosanna Maribel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rossana tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 8 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Nuestra amiga además de ser una muy buena madre y esposa estudia Ing. Civil en una universidad de Manta, ella para poder solventar los gastos que generan sus estudios y al ver que a su esposo no le alcanzaba para los gastos se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias, nos cuenta que su forma de venta es puerta a puerta por su localidad y también les vende a sus compañeras de la universidad donde estudia. Ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva 4 años en su negocio y gracias a esto ella puede estudiar y seguir con su carrera.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, sandalias. Lleva más de cuatro  años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
In the lower part of the city of Montecristi, known for its diversity of artisanal products such as the straw hats that are famous inside and outside of the country, the members of the Community Bank for the Progress of Women meet every fifteen days.
Here we meet Mrs. Rosanna, who is 28 years old. She is married and has an eight-year-old child who studies at the school. Her husband works at a factory in Manta.
Our friend, in addition to being a good mother and wife, studies civil engineering at the school in Manta. In order for her to pay her school expenses, and seeing that her husband cannot afford the expenses, she sells shoes and sandals. She sells these door to door in her neighborhood and also sells them to her classmates at the university where she studies. She sells the shoes on layaway and gets payments every fifteen days. She has been doing this business for the past four years. Thanks to this business she is able to study and continue with her career.
This loan will be used to buy shoes and sandals. She has been working with the communal bank for the past four years. With her first loan she started her business. Her dream is to finish her studies and be a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 11 y 6 años de edad, los  dos mayores  estudian en colegio y los menores en  escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, nos cuenta que de madrugada él parte en su carro hasta el mercado de mayoristas para surtirse de sus productos los mismos que luego los lleva a distribuir por toda la localidad en especial a los campos donde realiza muchas ventas, también en las tardes se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos material utilizado para la construcción de casas, él lleva más de 5 años con sus actividades comerciales con lo cual ha sacado adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y ladrillos. Lleva más de cinco años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudar en algo a su esposo.
 
Su sueño es comprar otro carro más grande ya que el que tienen está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its diversity of local products such as Panama hats known within and outside of the country, the members of the Communal Bank Mujeres Por el Progreso meet every 15 days. 

Here we meet Gloria, 30 years old, married and with 4 children. The oldest two, 15 and 13 years old, study in secondary school and the younger two, 11 and 6 years old, are in primary school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Our friend is using this loan for her husband who making a living selling fruits and vegetables. She tells us that at dawn he leaves in his car for the wholesale market to stock up on his products and later brings those same products to distribute throughout the area, especially to the areas where he makes many sales. In the afternoons he makes a living in the buying and selling of bricks used to build houses. He has five years of experience with this work with which he has helped his family get ahead.

This loan is to buy fruit, vegetables and bricks. She has been with the communal bank for five years and likes it because with the loans she can help her husband. Her dream is to buy a larger car because the one that they have is a little worn down.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and bricks.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Im is 50 years old. She is married and blesses with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs the taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $10 per day. Two of her children are employed in garment factory. They earn about $8 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Im is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase a walking tractor with a trailer to run the business of carrying firewood to sell. This money will help her acquire the security to start the new business and earn more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor with a trailer to run the business of carrying firewood to sell

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijas de 14, 11  y 6 años de edad, las mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga realiza el crédito para su esposo el cual tiene un tanquero con  el cual surte de agua a ciertas empresas y fabricas en la ciudad de Manta, nos cuenta que su esposo realiza varios viajes por dia ya que en estos lugares requieren mucho de este liquido vital para poder trabajar, nos cuenta que él recibe el pago semanal por la venta del agua por lo cual requiere de capital para seguir trabajando, él lleva más de 14 años dedicado a esta labor la cual les ha permitido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar agua y  combustibles para seguir trabajando. Lleva más de dos años en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pagos del grupo y  le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the lower part of the city of Montecristi, known for its diversity of artisanal products such as the straw hats that are famous inside and outside of the country, the members of the Community Bank for the Progress of Women meet every fifteen days.
Here we meet Maria, 32 years old, married with three daughters, ages 14, 11 and 6. The older ones study at the high school and the youngest studies at the primary school. Her husband is a driver.
Our friend is asking for this loan for her husband. He has a water tanker truck, which he uses to deliver water to certain companies and factories in Manta. Her husband makes several trips per day. His customers require a lot of this vital liquid in order to function. He is paid weekly for the water. He is asking for working capital in order to continue working. He has been doing this work for the past 14 years and the work has helped them to progress.
This loan will be used to buy water and fuel in order to continue working. He has been in the communal bank for the past two years. The bank helps facilitate the loans. The loans are a big help. 
Their dreams are to progress and to give their children a good education.

loans.use: to buy water and fuel.

loans.name: Ana Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad y aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es empleado privado.

Nuestra amiga con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda o cuando lleva mercadería nueva, ella sale a recorrer tres días de la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  más de 10 años y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its diversity of local products such as Panama hats known within and outside of the country, the members of the Banco Comunal Mujeres Por el Progreso meet every 15 days.

Here we meet Maria, who is 44 years old, is married and has four older children who still live with her. Her husband is a private employee.

Our friend has the intention of earning something on her own and by doing this, be able to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses. She makes a living selling all types of clothing. She sells door to door and also in her house, to where her customers arrive when they need a garment or when she has new merchandise. She travels three days a week, allows her customers to pay on credit, collecting money every 15 days. She goes to Guayaquil to purchase merchandise whenever it is necessary. She has made a living with this work for five years and it is going very well for her. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. She has been in this bank for more than 10 years. She likes it because of the help that the loans always give her to get ahead. Her dream is to have a large locale.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Fátima Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su diversidad de productos típicos como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país, se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fátima tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 6 y 1 años de edad, los  dos mayores  estudian en   escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Nuestra amiga es una mujer muy trabajadora que le ha gustado ganar por su cuenta su propio dinero por eso hace cuatro años atrás con la ayuda de su marido y reuniendo todos sus ahorros surtió una pequeña farmacia en su casa, la misma que con el paso del tiempo ha ido aumentando poco a poco y mucho mas desde que recibe los créditos del banco comunal, allí además de medicamentos ella también vende helados, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta la noche.

Este crédito es para comprar más medicinas y surtir más su negocio. Lleva un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le sirven de mucho cuando necesita surtir su negocio. 

Sus sueños son tener una gran farmacia y poder ayudar a las personas.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its diversity of local products such as Panama hats known within and outside of the country, the members of the communal bank Mujeres Por el Progreso meet every fifteen days. 

Here we meet Fatima who is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. Her two oldest children are 10 and 6 years old and study in school. Her youngest is 1 year old. Her husband works in a factory in Manta. 

Our friend is a very hard working woman who has liked to earn her own money. As such, four years back with the help of her husband and by gathering all of her savings she opened a small pharmacy in her house. This same pharmacy has, with time, expanded slowly and the much more after receiving loans from the communal bank. In addition to medication, she also sells ice cream, juices and sodas, among others. She works every day from 8:00 am until night.

This loan is to buy more medicines and to stock up her business more. She has been with the communal bank for a year and likes it because the loans serve her well when she needs to stock up her business. Her dreams are to have a large pharmacy and to be able to help others.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: El señora Gerardo es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien se dedica a la agricultura y la venta de leña desde hace más de 30 años. El invertirá el crédito en la preparación de la tierra (quema de basura, alquiler, arado, deshierbe, semilla, abono orgánico, abono completo, insecticidas…etc.)
texts.en: Mr. Gerardo is a hard working and entrepreneurial man who has been working in agriculture and selling firewood for over 30 years. He will invest this loan in land preparation (burning trash, rent, plowing, weeding, seeds, manure, complete fertilizer, insecticides, etc.)

loans.use: to prepare his land (burning trash, rent, plowing, weeding, seeds, manure, complete fertilizer, insecticides, etc.)

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Ее муж находится на заработках за рубежом. Она более шести лет занимается торговлей детской одежды и обуви. Торговлей она занимается у себя дома. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Shahnoza lives in the town of Istaravshan. She is 23 years old. She is married, with one child. Her husband is temporarily working abroad. For over six years, Shahnoza has been selling children's clothing and shoes. She sells out of her home. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy fabric, children's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Vivian Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Vivian del Socorro es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien desde hace 11 años tiene un taller de carpintería y vende artesanías  desde hace 11 años. El crédito lo invertirá en madera, pega, pintura…etc. para realizar centro de entretenimientos, sillas, ropero, silla abuela…etc.
texts.en: Vivian del Socorro is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has had a carpentry workshop and been selling handicrafts for 11 years.  She will invest the loan in wood, glue, paint, etc. to make entertainment centers, chairs, wardrobes, rocking chairs, etc.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue, paint, etc. to make entertainment centers, chairs, wardrobes, rocking chairs, etc.

loans.name: Yerald Augusto

texts.es: Yerald es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien tiene un taller de zapatos desde hace 20 años en el cual invertirá el crédito con la compra de cuero, galleta, cartón, suela, hielo, alistado, carbón, bolsa, papel….etc.
texts.en: Yerald is a hard-working and enterprising man who has had a shoe repair shop for 20 years, and he will invest his loan in it.  He will buy leather, heels, cardboard, soles, sewing materials, bags, paper, etc.

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, nails, glue, soles, etc.

loans.name: Los Almendros Del Coyolar Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Almendros del Coyolar está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Luisa María quien vende cosechas desde hace 30 años y elabora pan artesanal desde hace 25 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas, cerdo, harina, azúcar, manteca, leche, queso y leña.
Las otras integrantes son Juana de 42 años quien vende gaseosa y enchiladas, y José tiene una pulpería y cultiva.
texts.en: The group, "Almendros del Coyolar," is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is Luisa María, who has sold crops for 30 years and has made artisanal bread for 25 years.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of crops, pork, flour, sugar, butter, milk, cheese, and firewood.  The other members of the group are Juana, 42, who sells soft drinks and enchiladas, and José, who has a grocery store and practices agriculture.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Saven

texts.en: Saven is 54 years old. She is married and blessed with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a soldier who earns about $3 per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. Saven is building her house. Due to lack of funds, Saven is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase cement and bricks to use to construct her house. This money will help her provide more convenient living conditions for her family. In the future, she hopes to help her youngest child earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase cement and bricks to use to construct her house

loans.name: Sang Vat

texts.en: Sang Vat is 22 years old. She is married and blessed with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $4 per day. Sang is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase barbed wire and wooden posts to use for fence setting. This money will help her improve her home's security. In the future, she would like to send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase barbed wire and wooden posts to use for fence setting.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: Narciso reside en la zona rural del país, junto a su compañera de vida y dos hijas menores de edad. Él se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando frijoles y maíz y así mismo brindándole todo  el cuidado que requieren los cultivos, sus hijos a pesar de ser adolecentes le ayudan  con el negocio en sus tiempos libres, ya que también se dedican a estudiar. Este es el negocio familiar que les permite contar con todo lo que poseen en la actualidad, razón por la que para Narciso es fundamental incrementar su producción. Él solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar  mayor cantidad de frijoles y maíz para sembrar, así mismo para comprar cilindros de aluminio para depositar los granos y mantenerlos totalmente frescos. Al aumentar la siembra Narciso y su esposa podrán vender mayor cantidad de productos y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Narciso resides in a rural part of the country with his life companion and two young daughters. He is a farmer who grows beans and corn. Narciso provides everything that his crops need. Even though his children are teenagers, they help with the business during their free time in addition to focusing on their studies. This family business provides everything they currently own. For this reason, Narciso is adamant about increasing his production.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy a large quantity of beans and corn to plant. Narciso will also buy aluminum cylinders for storing grain so that it will always stay fresh. Since Narciso will increase his planting, his wife will be able to sell more products and increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds and cylinders for storing grain.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Milenio Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy Vilma, tiene 54 años, tiene 6 hijos que la apoyan ya que todos son mayores de edad e independientes, ella forma parte del grupo "Mujeres del Milenio", formado recientemente con 6 socios, todos comerciantes.
La Sra. nancy Vilma se dedica desde hace quince años a la preparación y venta de de salchipapa, actividad que realiza en la puerta de su domicilio, los fines de semana también ofrece caldo de gallina, manifiesta que éste es un trabajo muy sacrificado ya que empieza desde muy tempranito con las compras y durante el día en la preparación de insumos, pero es una actividad a la que ya está acostumbrada y gracias a ello puede tener tranquilidad económica, ella aún desea ampliar su negocio, crecer y poder ambientar un espacio para la atención de su clientela.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de insumos en mayor cantidad para comprarlos a menor precio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Señora Nancy Vilma is 54 and has 6 children who help her.  All are adults and are independent.  She is a part of the group, "Mujeres del Milenio," which formed recently and has 6 members, all of whom are merchants.  Nancy Vilma has made a living for 15 years making and selling salchipapa [sausage], work that she does from the door of her home.  On weekends she also offers chicken soup.  She says that this job requires a lot of sacrifice because she has to get up very early to go shopping and prepares the food during the day.  But it is work that she is now accustomed to and thanks to it, she can have economic calm.  She hopes to expand her business, to grow it, and to fix up a space to serve her customers.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of wholesale ingredients in large quantities so she can buy them at a lower price and obtain larger prices.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ingredients for salchipapa [sausage].

loans.name: Vannim

texts.en: Vannim is 55 years old. She is widowed and blessed with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling Khmer traditional cakes for more than 20 years, earning approximately $5 per day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $7 per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Vannim is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Seung

texts.en: Seung is 42 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in fishing for more than 20 years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 per day. In order to improve her business, Seung is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a boat engine to use for fishing. This purchase will help her run the business easier and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to help her child earn a Bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine to use for fishing

loans.name: Armonia Y Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Flor Karina, tiene 31 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Ella forma parte del Grupo "Armonía y triunfo", integrado por 7 socios, todos ellos comerciantes.
la Sra. Flor Karina, desde hace 5 meses a la venta de pollo en un mercado de la zona donde vive, consiguió éste negocio para poder afrontar gastos de mantención de sus hijos, le ha ido bien, pero con el préstamo recibido desea aumentar la compra de pollo para poder tener mayor venta y así aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
Sra. Flor Karina is 31 years old and has two children. She is a member of the group “Armonía y Trunfo” (Harmony and Triumph), which consists of seven members. All of them are merchants.

Sra. Flor Karina has been selling chickens for five months at a market in the area where she lives. She continues with her business so that she can handle the expenses of sustaining her children, who are doing well. Flor Karina is receiving this loan because she wants to increase her purchase of chickens so that she can have more to sell and expand her customer base.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of chickens to sell.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat is 26 years old. She is married and blessed with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer. In addition, he runs the business of renting a threshing machine and delivery service. He earns approximately $13 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phat is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland as well as for rental. This purchase will enable her to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland and for renting

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Hog raising has been the business of Leonida. She wakes up early in the morning to feed her hogs and clean the pigpen. She has been doing these things in order to have a better way of living, since she is a widow and lives separately with her five children.

Leonida plans to buy more stock of hog feed, vitamins and vaccine in order for her to minimize her expenses in going to and from the market. Due to insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000. This amount would really be of great help in the attainment of her goal in life. She just hopes that she can maintain her hog-raising business to be able to have continuous improvement of her business, which will enable her to gain more income to sustain her needs.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: La señora Teresa de Jesús es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 16 años y con las ganancias desde hace 2 años ha invertido en la compra de ropa negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la comprar de mercadería en blusas, pantalones, talladores, camisetas y faldas.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesús is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman who has run her own beauty salon for 16 years, and with the profits she made over the last 2 years she invested in a clothing business. She will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise such as blouses, pants, size dividers, shirts and skirts.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as blouses, pants, size dividers, shirts and skirts.

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Iglesia lo conforma Gilma, Sadia y Rosario tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Gilma es la coordinadora del grupo y se dedica a la agricultura y la realización de enchiladas desde hace 8 años. El crédito lo invertirá en yuca, frijoles y leña.

Sadia es profesora y tiene un negocio de vende comida y chiverías, granos basicos...etc. Mientras Rosario  desde hace 27 años tiene una tortillería.
texts.en:
The La Iglesia (The Church) group is made up of Gilma, Sadia and Rosario - three female workers and entrepreneurs. Gilma is the coordinator of the group and is has worked in agriculture and producing enchiladas for 8 years. This loan will be invested in cassava, beans and firewood.

Sadia is a teacher and has a business selling food and snacks, basic grains, etc. Rosario has run a tortilla stall for 27 years.

loans.use: to cultivate cassava and purchase beans and firewood.

loans.name: El Valle De Huaquillay Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Esther Silvia, tiene 50 años de edad, ella forma parte del grupo "El Valle de Huaquillay", formado recientemente por 5 personas, que trabajan de forma independiente con la finalidad de sacar adelante a su familia.
La Sra. Esther Silvia, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboración de articulos de cerámica, actividad que realiza en su domicilio, poco a poco con la ayuda de su familia ha hecho crecer esta actividad, y sobretodo aumentar su clientela, trabaja bajo pedido, los cuales son ofrecidos en los centros artesanales que son visitados por turistas de distintos países.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus cerámicas y atender pedidos fijos de clientes.
texts.en: Esther Silvia, 50, is part of "The Valley of Huaquillay" recently formed by 5 people who working independently in order to raise their families. Esther Silvia has been producing ceramic articles for 10 years. She works at home and with the help of her family she has grown her business little by little, and above all she has increased her clientele. She works to order, and offers her wares in craft centers which are visited by tourists from different countries. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies needed for the preparation of ceramics and to meet fixed customer orders.

loans.use: to purchase supplies needed for the preparation of ceramic articles.

loans.name: Antonela Group

texts.es:
El grupo Antonela lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Lea quien es fundadora desde grupo desde el 2008. Ella es profesora de primaria desde hace 29 años y comercializa prendas  de oro y plata e invertirá en chapa, collares, pulseras…etc. 
Lea es casada y tiene tres hijos.
Las otras integrantes son Ana quien vende prendas y es docente desde hace 12 años y Claudia quien trabaja como niñera y vende ropa.
texts.en:
The Antonela group is made up of three hard working and enterprising women. One of them is Lea who is the founder of the group, since 2008. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for 29 years and sells gold and silver jewelry. She will invest the loan in necklaces, bracelets, etc. Lea is married with three children.

The other members are Ana who sells clothing and has been working as a teacher for 12 years, and Claudia who works as a nanny and sells clothing.

loans.use: to purchase gold and silver jewelry (necklaces, bracelets etc)

loans.name: Jenny Alexandra

texts.es: Jenny vive en Libertad, ciudad turística de Ecuador por sus hermosas playas. Tiene 33 años su esposo es conductor de vehículos pesados en una cantera, tienen 3 hijos de 16, 13 y 12 años quienes asisten a la escuela fiscal. En su domicilio hace 6 años abrió mini despensa donde empezó vendiendo helados, arroz, azúcar, colas. Al principio lo hacía por una ventana de su casa y los productos lo tenía almacenado en sus cartones, ahora cuenta con un espacio adecuado para el negocio y a comprado varias perchas en las cuales ofrece el producto. Con el tiempo ha ido surtiendo y aumentando la variedad de los mismos por pedido de los clientes. Vende víveres, artículos de limpieza, productos de primera necesidad y gas. La atención la realiza ella sin problemas porque sus hijos esta grandes y no demandan tanto cuidado. Jenny solicita el crédito para la compra de cilindros de gas y mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en: Jenny, 33, lives in Libertad, a touristy city in Ecuador known for beautiful beaches. Her husband drives heavy vehicles in a quarry. They have 3 children, ages 16,13 and 12, who they help with school costs. Six years ago, she opened a small store in her home where she began selling ice cream, rice, sugar and sodas. At the beginning she did it through a window and stored the products in their boxes. Now she has a space for her business and has bought shelving to place the product on. Over time she has stocked her store and increased the variety of products at the request of her customers. She sells food, cleaning supplies, basic goods and gas. She doesn't have problems attending to her customers because her kids are grown and don't need as much care. Jenny asks for a loan to buy gas cylinders and merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries, cleaning supplies, basic goods and gas.

loans.name: Ángel Manuel

texts.es: Ángel Manuel, vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y así mismo junto a sus hijos. Ángel  trabaja muy duro realizando siembra de frijoles y maíz, lo cual es una actividad que ha aprendido muy bien, brindando gran calidad en sus productos. Así mismo Ángel  junto a su esposa venden los granos básico en diferentes tiendas de conveniencia y mercados, y así mismo comercializan en su casa de habitación. Ángel  desea todo lo mejor para su familia y siempre brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más semilla de frijol y de maíz y así poder aumentar su producción de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Ángel Manuel lives with his wife, who devotes herself to the household chores, and their children. He works very hard planting beans and corn since this is an activity that he learned very well. As a result, he is able to provide a large quantity of products. Ángel and his wife also sell basic grains to different convenience stores and markets, as well as from their home. He wants all the best for his family, so he always tries to provide everything his children need.

Ángel is requesting a loan so that he will have the necessary funds for buying more bean and corn seeds in order to increase his production of basic grains.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Sarah W.

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has eight children ages 14 to 32. Three of them are in school and live at home. The oldest ones are working and living on their own. 

For the past fifteen years, Sarah has been selling charcoal in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is now 59 years old but still she enjoys doing her work because it's her family's main source of income. She is married and has five children. Two of her children have settled for marriage while her other three children are already working.

Mercedes has been involved in a beauty salon business for 20 years. She does not have a fixed stall location where she could have all the equipment needed to provide her services due to the insufficient capital she has. At her age, she aims to have a fixed location for her beauty salon, so that she will no longer perform her services on a house-to-house basis. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 allowing her to buy rebonding chemicals, nail cuticle products and nail polish for her beauty salon business. She believes that this loan will help her to obtain greater profits, which will enable her to provide quality service to customers and be able to cover all her household expenses and have a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy rebonding chemicals, nail cuticle products, nail polish and different colors of cutex for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Dina Monica

texts.es: Dina de 45 años vive en Duran en el barrio conocido como El Recreo. Su esposo Alfonso se dedica igual que ella a la venta de calzado al por menor, juntos tiene 3 hijos menores que estudian en la escuela. Hace 12 años empezó esta actividad ya que dejo de trabajar como profesora de un colegio. Cuando comenzó recorría diversos sectores ofertando el producto puerta a puerta, un tiempo después deicidio alquilar un local estable en la bahía. La bahía es un sector comprendido de 2 manzanas donde existe un conglomerado de comerciantes de diversos productos. Es muy conocido y visitado ya que los productos se consiguen a un menor precio. Su local es de pequeño pero está muy surtido ofreciendo la mayor variedad posible porque la competencia ahí es muy dura. Con el crédito Dina comprara zapatos por mayor esperando en algún futuro convertirse en comerciante mayorista
texts.en: Dina is 45-years-old and lives in Duran in a neighborhood known as El Recreo.  Her husband Alfonso works alongside her selling shoes in a retail shop.  Together they have three young children who are still in school.  12 years ago she began this work after leaving her job as a school teacher.  When she began, she went through many areas of the city selling door to door but later decided to rent a shop in the la bahía (the bay).  La bahía is an area made up of two blocks where there is a group of sellers of all kinds of different products.  It is well-known and visited as the products can be got for lower prices.  Her shop is small but well-stocked and offers the greatest variety possible because the competition there is very stiff.  With the loan, Dina will buy shoes at wholesale prices in the hopes of one day becoming a wholesale seller.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Zhullin  (Azogues) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhullin está formado por 11 socias, quienes viven por las afueras de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es de clima frió, sus relieves la hacen especial ya que toda la ciudad se sitúa en una zona inclinada, su gastronomía típica cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente es amable, gentil y de un corazón cálido, laboran en diferentes actividades ya sea como en la realización de artesanías, comercio, cría de animales y en la agricultura, se caracterizan también por aun mantener viva su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gloria, tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 13, 11, 9, 6 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo  estudia en el colegio y tres de sus hijos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad construida con el sacrificio conyugal. 

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos.

Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar este negocio para poder aportar a la economía de su hogar.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio que va a iniciar.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Zhullin” consists of 11 members who live outside of the city of Azogues. This city is known for its cold weather. The topography makes this place unique since the entire city is situated on an incline. The traditional cuisine captivates the palates of both locals and foreigners. The people are friendly, kind, and warm-hearted. They work in different business activites such as crafts, trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture. In addition, they are known for keeping their culture and traditions alive.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Gloria. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children (ages 13, 11, 9, 6, and 1). Her oldest child is in high school and three of her children attend elementary school in the city. Her husband works in the construction sector as a bricklayer. The house in which they live was built as a result of sacrifices they have made in their marriage.

Gloria devotes her time to the household chores and to looking after her children. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank and she will invest the funds in the purchase of chickens so that she can start a business that will enable her to provide for the household finances. Her goal is to grow the business that she is about to start.

The smaller photo is that of a member who was not present when the group photograph was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es: José Ángel de 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad respectivamente. Él es un padre muy trabajador y responsable quien labora arduamente en su pequeña parcela. José siembra granos básicos como frijoles y maíz, un trabajo bastante duro pero que sabe realizar muy bien. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de aumentar la cantidad de maíz y frijoles que siembra, con esto José espera sembrar más del doble de lo que lo ha hecho anteriormente y así explotar al máximo su parcela. José desea mucho que sus hijos salgan adelante y que toda su familia cuente con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna, lo cual podrá alcanzar aumentando sus ventas gracias al préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
José Ángel is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 8 and 6 respectively. He is a hardworking and responsible father who manages a small parcel of land. José grow basic crops, such as beans and corn. Even though this is a hard job, he knows how to do it very well.

José is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral because he wants to increase the quantity of corn and beans that he plants. As a result, he hopes to more than double his previous harvest and make the most of his land. José would very much like for his children to get ahead and to provide his entire family everything they need to have a decent life. He will be able to increase his sales as a result of the loan he requested.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for planting corn and beans.

loans.name: Angela Ignacia

texts.es: Angela tiene 3 años viviendo en Isla Trinitaria sector sur de Guayaquil. se mudo hace poco porque al fin ha podido dejar habitable su casa, está construida de ladrillo y cuenta con luz, agua, alcantarillado y camino pavimentado gracias a la regeneración urbana. Se siente contenta porque es uno de los pocos sectores que cuentas con esas comodidades. A sus 39 años Angela es estilista, desde muy joven le gusto todo lo referente a la moda y maquillaje es por eso que realizo varios cursos para aprender el oficio. Su manera de trabajar es visitando a sus clientes al domicilio llevando sus herramientas, lo realiza de esta manera ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder abrir un gabinete de belleza. No tiene un horario fijo pero cuando la llaman siempre acude a sus visitas. Actualmente a tomado una decisión muy importante en su vida la cual espera se desarrolle con éxito, va a incursionar en la venta de ropa esperando tener acogida. El credito que solicita lo utilizara en la compra de cosméticos para su negocio y tambien en ropa para empezar el nuevo. Este reto lo toma por su hijo, siendo madre soltera quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida y apoyarlos en sus estudios. Sus sueños más importante es ver graduado a su hijo y encaminado a una carrera prospera, en su negocio poder abrir un local donde vender sus productos y ofrecer sus servicios.
texts.en: Angela has lived for three years on Isla Trinitaria in the southern part of Guayaquil.  She moved recently because she has finally been able to make her house habitable.  It is made of brick and has electricity, water, sewer, and paved roads – thanks to urban renewal.  She feels happy because it is one of the few areas with these amenities.  At 39-years-old, Angela is a stylist.  Since she was very young she has liked everything to do with style and make-up and this is why she has taken several courses to learn the profession.  Her method of work is to visit her customers in their homes, taking her tools with her.  She does it in this way because she doesn’t have the capital she needs to open a shop.  She doesn’t have a fixed schedule because when they call her she always goes.  Currently she is undertaking a very important life decision which she hopes will be successful.  She is going to begin selling clothing in  the hope that it will be well-received.  She will use the loan to buy cosmetics for her business as well as clothing to begin the new business.  She is taking on this challenge for her son; as she is a single mother she wants to give him a better quality of life and help him with his studies.  Her biggest dreams are to see her son graduate and begin the path to a prosperous career and in her business to be able to open a shop where she can sell her products and offer her services.

loans.use: to buy nail polishes, nail files, lotions, and clothing.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria nació en Los Ríos hace 54 años, cuando era pequeña sus padres decidieron trasladarse a vivir a Guayaquil para mejorar su calidad de vida. Actualmente tiene 5 años viviendo en Paraíso de la Flor donde tiene su taller de costura, como experiencia tiene 12 años en esta actividad la cual inicio muy joven  asistiendo a la academia, luego adquirio una maquina de segunda de mano con la cual empezo a recibir costuras. Desde que aprendió se ha dedicado a la costura porque le gusta y por la necesidad de tener un medio de para ganarse la vida. Lo que mas le solicitan son vestido de salir, uniformes escolares y de trabajo, tambien realiza arreglos. Maria se separo de su esposo hace varios años y vive actualmente solo con uno de sus hijos que es menor de edad, los 2 otros son mayores e independientes. También se dedica a la venta de encebollados trabajo que realiza junto a sus hijos. El préstamo que Maria solicita será para la compra de una maquina industrial con la que mejorarían sus ingresos y podría confeccionar ropa en serie.
texts.en: Maria was born in Los Ríos 54-years-ago and when she was young her parents decided to move to Guayaquil to live to improve their quality of life.  She currently lives in Paraíso de la Flor (Flower’s Paradise) where she has been for five years and where she has her sewing workshop.  She has 12 years of experience as a seamstress, work she began when she was very young helping in the academy.  Later she acquired a second hand sewing machine which she used to begin receiving orders.  Since she learned, she has worked in sewing because she likes it and because she needs to have a way to earn a living.  What she is asked to make most are dresses for going out and uniforms for school and work, as well as mending.  Maria separated from her husband several years ago and currently lives alone with one of her children who is still a minor.  The two others are older and independent.  She also works selling encebollados (a stew made with onions and meat), work that she does alongside her children.  Maria is requesting the loan to buy an industrial sewing machine which she can use to increase her income as she will be able to make multiple garments at a time.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Henry Geovany

texts.es: Henry tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene una hija, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, es una familia muy unida y el trabajo lo realizan en equipo, en algunas ocasiones han tenido problemas de salud y económicos pero siempre lo han podido resolver. Henry comenzó a cultivar maíz y frijoles desde hace seis años y en la actualidad se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y sandia, es una persona con mucha experiencia en la siembra de los granos, el negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, el horario laboral es variable y durante todo el día, el trabajo lo realiza con algunos empleados solo en tiempo de cosecha y en ocasiones lo realiza solo. Su ventaja es que cuando el tiempo climático es agradable la cosecha le resulta muy buena y abundante. Los problemas que enfrenta en los cultivos son las diferentes plagas que ocasionan daños a la cosecha por lo que Henry invertirá el préstamo en la compra de urea, en el arado de la tierra, en el arreglo de la propiedad y pago de mano de obra a sus empleados. Con la ayuda de este préstamo el podrá mejorar sus cultivos y sus cosechas serán muy buenas. Este es el tercer financiamiento que obtiene Henry en FAMA y ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Henry is 33 years old, married, and has one daughter. His wife is a homemaker. They are a very close family who perform their work as a team. At times they have suffered health or financial problems but they have always been able to resolve them.

Henry began growing corn and beans six years ago. Today, he grows basic grains and watermelon. He is a person with a great deal of experience growing grains. He learned the business on his own initiative. His work schedule varies and during the day, he works with some employees during harvest season. Other times, he works alone. His advantage is that when the climate is agreeable, the resulting harvest is very good and abundant. The problems he faces are the different plagues that can damage his crops. Therefore, Henry will invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizer, plowing his land, fixing up his property, and paying his employees for their labor. With the help of this loan, he will be able to improve his crops and his harvests will be very good. This is the third loan Henry has obtained from FAMA and he has complied punctually with the repayment of his prior loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, make repairs to his property, and pay laborers

loans.name: Melania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Melania está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Flor Melania de 49 años quien se dedica a la venta de plantas desde hace 3 años, además lava y plancha. El crédito lo invertirá en penca, rosas, narcisos, laurel y cítricos.
Las otras integrantes son Modesta del Carmen quien se dedica a la venta de queso y leche desde hace 7 años y Carlos quien es guarda de seguridad y vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Melania group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising individuals. One of them is Flor Melania. She is 49 years old and has been selling plants for three years. She also does washing and ironing. She will invest this loan in cacti, roses, daffodils, laurel and citrus plants.

The other members are Modesto del Carmen, who has been selling cheese and milk for seven years, and Carlos, who is a security guard and sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to invest in cacti, roses, daffodils, laurel, and citrus plants.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn is 41 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling charcoal for more than seven years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a battery charging business. He earns about $8 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Thorn is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a walking tractor with a trailer to use for carrying charcoal to sell. This purchase would enable her to carry charcoal in larger amounts and earn more money to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor with a trailer for carrying charcoal.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali lives in Kaloleni, Mombasa. He works everyday because his dream is to have a store that is well-known in his town. In order to do this, he sells vegetables to his neighbors’ and passersby at a vegetable stall. With this, he has managed to save and invest in another business of farming vegetables and fruits that has provided the opportunity to generate new income.

The lack of working capital in the face of  Ali’s dreams are his biggest challenge, this is why he has turned to Kiva and his first loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With his Kiva loan he will buy sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, and potatoes which are in high demand during this rainy season. His loan should be successful because his sales are based on customer orders. What he buys has a fast turnover, which causes his working capital to turn quickly and therefore increase his profits. Choosing good customers would increase the recovery of his capital and thereby his earnings.

loans.use: to buy sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, and potatoes.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura lives in the coastal region of Kenya, in Msambweni. She owns a kiosk that has been in operation for seven years. She started the business recently from the amount saved from her first loan. Her main business challenge is the lack of on-time payments by some customers. Despite this, Zuhura is determined to expand her business and be in a position to start a wholesale business in the future. 
 
She is requesting a second loan of 25,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase stocks of maize flour, cooking oil and sugar. The additional income from this loan will help her restock the shop.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

loans.name: Madaraka

texts.en:
Because of his need to generate an income so that he can improve his family’s well-being, Madaraka began his business of buying and selling clothes. Madaraka is a married man who lives with his wife and three children, all of whom attend school. His main clients are the neighboring community members. 

Madaraka is requesting a loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization he has been a part of for five years and that made it possible for him to set up his business, in order to give it a more comfortable environment. He will use the money from this loan to buy bales of clothes for resale in order to increase his opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers who have been referred by the current buyers and those whose attention he wants to capture.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa, 50, leaves in Msambweni, Kenya.  He is a good entrepreneur, and for two years he has owned his own business. He operates a business transporting goods such as  blocks, soil and sand. In addition, Issa operates a kiosk which he has been running for the past one year. Today his dreams continue to grow and his goals are to continue increasing his income so that he can establish a retail shop business and expand to a wholesale shop and become very successful.

Issa's market is growing and so is the amount of capital that he needs to continue providing the products his customers demand.  This will be his first loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. He will use it to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar that he will promote in his business with special discounts. He wants to offer great prices to his customers so that he can continue earning their loyalty, and this is why he will be successful in investing his Credit Kiva loan in his business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa, 33, is a single woman. She lives in Msambweni, Kenya and has sold clothes for the last three years. Recently, she started a grocery store to supplement her first business in order to increase her monthly income. Her businesses have allowed her to get ahead and earn enough money to enjoy some comforts. 

Mayasa is requesting a 25,000 KES loan, which will be her fourth funding through Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy grocery shop items such as maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She plans to buy these items in bulk so that she will generate greater profits. Her goal is to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy grocery shop items to sell.

loans.name: C8099 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Annonciathe is 53 years old and is married with six children between 1 and 10 years old. She sells food and drinks like Fanta, beans, meat and bananas. Annonciathe is the president of the group called C8099 Abishyizehamwe in the local language, and she is the one who has a paper in her hand in the photo. She currently employs six people to help her and the hours of her business are from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily every week. 

Annonciathe has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her restaurant by buying large quantities of food and drinks like Fanta, beans, meat and bananas for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future, reinvest in her business, renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant by buying large quantities of food and drinks like Fanta, beans, meat and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Femme de 41ans, Madame ama est revendeuse de tissus depuis 2002 dans un marché de la place. Son conjoint exerce la même activité qu’elle et ils ont ensemble 03 enfants dont 02 à l'école. Une personne l’aide dans l’exécution de ses taches. Elle sollicite un second crédit de WAGES pour acheter de nouveaux tissus afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut elle même aller chez les fabricants de tissus en CHINE pour commander ses tissus afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Son souhait est de prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les dépenses financières de leurs 03 enfants.
texts.en:
A 41-year-old woman, Mrs. Ama has been a fabric retailer at a local market since 2002. Her spouse has the same job that she does and they have three children together, two of whom are in school. One person helps her carry out her work.

Ama is seeking a second loan from WAGES in order to buy new fabric to better respond to her clients' needs. She wants to go herself to the fabric manufacturers in China to order her fabrics, in order to make more of a profit. Her wish is to assist her spouse with the financial expenses of their three children.

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Phallai

texts.en:
Phallai is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with two children and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than six years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs the taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. 

Because the present motorbike is old, Phallai is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the service. This purchase will help her husband attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new wooden house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has been a home service beautician for almost 25 years. She is widower with seven children. She is really blessed because despite her situation, being the bread winner of the family, she is still able to sustain their daily household expenses.

She aims to increase her income to be able to send her children to school, but she struggles with financial shortage, which is the reason why she asks for additional capital. Josefina is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to allow her to buy the necessary materials for her beauty salon business such as nail polish, nail  cuticle products and chemicals for hair re-bonding and relaxers. She knows that through this requested loan amount she could make her dreams possible.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon business such as nail polish, nail cuticle  products and chemicals for hair re-bonding.

loans.name: Teresa Maricely

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Teresa, ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 13, 11 y 8 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es cerrajero.

Nuestra amiga realiza los créditos para el negocio de su esposo que es un negocio familiar, tienen un taller de cerrajería en el cual realizan una variedad de trabajos con el metal, fabrican ventanas, puertas, techos, cerramientos, entre otros trabajos, trabajan de lunes a sabados con la ayuda de una persona y cuando tiene bastantes trabajos hasta dos personas más a  quienes  les paga su sueldo semanal, los materiales para su trabajo los compra en Portoviejo y a veces trabaja sin materiales solo la mano de obra.

Este crédito es para comprar materiales como varillas de hierro, laminas de metal,  soldaduras entre otros materiales. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes para sacar adelante su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener una ferretería bien surtida.
texts.en:
The community bank Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro meets every two weeks in the town of 30 de Septiembre in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for its delicious candies that are made by the locals and recognized throughout the country.
In this place, we met Teresa. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children of 13, 11, and 8 years of age who are in school. Her husband is a locksmith.
Our friend is taking out a loan for her husband's business which is a family business. They have a locksmith's workshop where they do a variety of metal work - they make windows, doors, roofs, enclosures, and other work. They work Monday to Saturday with the help of one person and when there is enough work there are two other people who they pay a weekly wage. They buy the materials for the work in Portoviejo and sometimes work without materials, doing only laboring. 
This loan is to buy materials such as iron rods, metal sheets, and welding supplies, amongst others. Teresa is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the loans are very important for their business' success.
Her dream is to have a well supplied hardware shop.

loans.use: to buy iron rods, sheet metal, welding supplies, etc

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Génesis lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Eliezer quien se dedica a la venta de Sandalias desde hace 3 años  negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de mercadería en calzado.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Manfield quien vende bolsos y fajas y Xiomara quien comercializa cosméticos.
texts.en:
The loan group Génesis is comprised of 3 hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Eliezer, who has been selling sandals for 3 years. He will use the loan for this business and will buy supplies of shoes.
The other members of the group are Manfield, who sells bags and belts and Xiomara, who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy supplies of shoes.

loans.name: Nancy Liliana

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela 30 de Septiembre del cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Plazoleta Eloy Alfaro. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.
