She started a small trading business selling blankets and bed sheets at home. Now she has applied for this loan to buy more bed covers to increase her inventory and revenue so she can, in the future, open her own storage room to distribute to other stores in the market.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers.

loans.name: Reyna Judid

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Judid, tiene 62  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su marido trabaja en la junta de agua potable de Charapoto.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto poder contribuir con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, tiene un puesto en el mercado de Charapoto donde vende frutas y legumbres, trabaja los viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 5h00 hasta las 18h00, además de esto ella también vende ropa de todo tipo en los días que no está en el mercado, la ropa la lleva a vender a Pedernales ciudad a la que viaja todos los lunes y regresa los jueves al medio día, se queda en esa ciudad realizando ventas y cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. La ropa la compra en Portoviejo y lo que es frutas y legumbres en el mismo mercado a comerciantes mayoristas. Ella lleva más de 15 años dedicada al comercio.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y ropa  que es lo que más ganancias le dejan. Lleva más de dos años  en el Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda con bazar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “La Rosa de Guadalupe” meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto. This city is known for its traditional culture. In addition, two of the best beaches in the province are located a few minutes away – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Judid. She is 62 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three adult children. One of them still lives at home. Her husband works with the drinking water committee in Charapoto.

In order to earn her own income and contribute to the household expenses, Judid decided to establish a business. She has a stall at the market in Charapoto where she sells fruits and legumes. Judid works Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 5am to 6pm. In addition, she sells all types of clothes on the days when she is not at the market. Judid takes the clothes to the city of Pedernales in order to sell them. She travels every Monday and returns on Thursdays around noon. Judid stays in Pedernales in order to conduct sales and collect payments. She extends credit and collects every eight days. The clothing is purchased in Portoviejo and she acquires fruits and legumes at the same market from the wholesale vendors. Judid has been in business for more than 15 years.

This loan will be used to buy fruits, legumes, and clothing so that she can earn more profit. Judid has been with the Communal Bank for more than two years and likes the assistance the loans have given her. Her dream is to have a store with a bazaar.

loans.use: to buy fruits, legumes, and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy looms

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en:
Raeda is a 27-year-old housewife caring for two sons. Her husband is a public sector employee.

Raeda wants to help her husband in maintaining a good financial base to provide their kids with the best life they can have; for that, she used her humble experience in hairstyling to start a beauty salon business at home.

Now Raeda has applied for a youth loan to buy new tools until one day she can expand and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy new tools.

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.en:
Abduvahob is a very honest and attentive father and husband. He is working in order to provide his family.  He has engaged in cattle breeding for 16 years. Also, he sells dried apricots. Of course, his family supports him in his business, especially his wife. His wife is a housewife, that’s why she has time to take care of housework and also help her husband. 

He has an excellent credit history. Abduvahob would like to get a loan in the size of $3,000 USD for purchasing cattle in order to expand his business. This friendly and hardworking family is hoping for your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Solissaman Group

texts.fr: Aidé par 03 personnes dans l’exercice de son activité, Mr Tchamtcha est cultivateur de profession. Il est père de 03 adorables enfants dont 02 sont encore sur les bancs d’école. Ils ont entre 11 et 04ans. Il maitrise bien son activité et est dans ce domaine il y a 17ans. Son second cycle qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des produits pour son activité. Elle se déroule en RÉGION CENTRALE. Il est le responsable du groupement SOLISSAMAN qui est constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui sont tous dans le domaine de la terre. Ce prêt qu’ils sollicitent leur permettra d’acheter des outils de travail. Ils veulent assurer la santé, la scolarité des enfants, augmenter la superficie cultivable afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients et dans l'avenir vendre leurs produits à l'étranger.
texts.en:
Mr. Tchamtcha is a farmer and father of three adorable children aged 4 to 11, two of whom attend school. With 17 years of experience, he has a good command of his activity. Three people assist him in his work. This is his second loan cycle, and he will use the funds to buy farming-related products. 

He conducts his activity in the center of the region. He is the leader of the group SOLISSAMAN, which consists of men and women who all work with the land. The loan they are seeking will allow them to purchase farming equipment. 

Their goals are to provide for their children’s healthcare and education, to increase their farmable area to better meet customer demand, and to eventually export their products.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment and products.

loans.name: Maluay  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Maluay está formado por 12 socias, quienes viven por la comunidad de que lleva el mismo nombre perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, se encuentra rodeado de montañas las mismas que nos permiten tener una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su arquitectura se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestras socias son mujeres amables, gentiles, tienen un gran carisma, se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras, luchadoras que laboran a diario para mejorar su economía y entregarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, aun mantienen la gastronomía tradicional de sus pueblos así como la cultura y tradiciones. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Doralisa, tiene 43 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, uno es casado y vive independiente, 2 trabajan y le ayudan económicamente en la casa, 1 estudia en el colegio y sus 4 últimos hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María Doralisa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, labora hace 5 años en el reciclaje pero solo dos días de la semana, en casa cría y vende cerdos, pollos y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo del hogar.

Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando pollos y cuyes para seguir creciendo en esta actividad.

El sueño de nuestra socia es comprarse un vehículo. 

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Maluay” communal bank is composed of 12 members who live in a community of the same name belonging to Valle Parish in Cuenca.  This place has a cold climate and is surrounded by mountains that allow us to have a beautiful view of nature.  Its architecture blends the modern with the colonial; its residents preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.  Our members are nice, kind, very charismatic women who are noted for being very hardworking and tenacious and who work daily to improve their economy and give their children a better future.  They still preserve traditional cuisine of its peoples as well as their culture and traditions.

One of this group’s members is María Doralisa, 43.  She’s a widow and has 8 children.  One of them is married and lives on his own; two work and help her economically at home, one is attending secondary school and her four youngest are attending the little local school.  The house she lives in his hers.

María Doralisa does household chores and for the last five years has been working recycling but only two days of the week.  At home she raises and sells pigs, chickens and guinea pigs and also works in agriculture; what she grows is for home consumption.

She’s been in the communal bank for four years and will use the new loan to buy chicks and guinea pigs to continue growing in this activity.  Her dream is to purchase a vehicle.

The two small photos are of three members who were unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chicks and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Maluay De Curiquinga  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Maluay de Curiquinga está formado por 11 socias, quienes viven por la comunidad de Maluay en la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, se encuentra rodeado de montañas las mismas que nos permite tener una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su arquitectura se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestras socias son mujeres amables, gentiles, tienen un gran carisma, se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras, luchadoras que laboran a diario para mejorar su economía y entregarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, aun mantienen la gastronomía tradicional de sus pueblos así como la cultura y tradiciones. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa,  tiene 51 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos, sus 3 primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, 3 se dedican a trabajar para solventar sus gastos personales, 2 de sus hijos pasan en casa ayudando en los quehaceres del hogar y sus 2 últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo debido a su edad pasa en casa, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y a la agricultura, cultiva sus terrenos y su cosecha es solo para el consumo de su casa, también cría y vende cerdos, pollos, cuyes y tiene una vaca, sus animales los vende en su comunidad. 

Se encuentra en el cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en materiales de construcción para construir un galpón más grande para los pollos y en la compra de cerdos.

Su sueño es tener una tienda.
texts.en:
The “Maluay de Curiquinga” communal bank is composed of 11 members who live in a community of Maluay belonging to Valle Parish in Cuenca.  This place has a cold climate and is surrounded by mountains that allow us to have a beautiful view of nature.  Its architecture blends the modern with the colonial; its residents preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.  Our members are nice, kind, very charismatic women who are noted for being very hardworking and tenacious and who work daily to improve their economy and give their children a better future.  They still preserve traditional cuisine of its peoples as well as their culture and traditions.

One of this group’s members is Rosa, 51.  She’s married and has had ten children.  Her oldest three children are married and live on their own, three work to cover their personal expenses, two of her children stay home and help with housework and her two youngest attend the little local school.  Her husband stays home due to his age and the house they live in is theirs.

Rosa does household chores and farms.  What she grows in her fields is for home consumption.  She also raises and sells pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and she has a cow.  She sells her animals in her community.

This is the fourth loan she’s taken out with the communal bank and she will use it to buy building supplies to build a larger shed for the chickens and to buy pigs.  Her dream is to own a store.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Victor Alfredo

texts.es: Victor en Milagros su ciudad natal se dedica a la venta de plátano y cacao. Su casa está ubicada en el recinto 10 de agosto es de cemento y cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz. A sus 50 años cuenta que siempre a vivido en fincas, le gusta la tierra y el aire puro que se respira fuera de las ciudades. Desde que era niño aprendió todo lo referente a la plantación y cuidado de las plantas. Adicional también se dedica a la crianza de chanchos para  su venta. Como en toda finca su horario de trabajo empieza desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde ya que se aprovecha la luz solar. Sus tierra son fertiles es por es que tiene gran cantidad de plantas de banano y cacao, cuando coge la cosecha sus puntos de venta son el pueblo donde oferta a los compradores minoristas. En la foto se lo observa cerca de una planta de cacao, el color del fruto rojizo indica que esta maduro y que se puede seguir el proceso de secado para la venta. La época más difícil es la invernal ya que por las lluvias se inundan ciertas partes de su finca y por tal motivo baja la producción. Victor se encuentra separado de su esposa con la que tiene 2 hijos, por el momento la menor vive con él y está estudiando en la academia corte y confección, su otro hijo ya es mayor e independiente. El crédito que solicita será para la compra de tierra de sembrado, semillas y balanceado por sacos. Espera mejorar la producción y arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Victor, in Milagros, his native city, works in banana and cacao sales.  His house is located in the building 10 de Agosto.  It is made of cement and has the water and light services.  At his 50 years he tells us that he has always lived on farms. He likes the earth and the pure air that can be breathed away from the cities.  

Since he was a child, he has learned everything related to the plantation and plant care.  Additionally he works in the rearing of pigs for sale.  As in all farms, his work schedule is from 5 in the morning until 6 in the evening, since he takes advantage of the sunlight.  The lands are fertile, and because of this he has a large quantity of banana and cacao plants.  When he gathers the harvest, his selling locations are the town, where he offers it buyers of retail.  In the photo he is observed near a cacao plant.  The reddish color of the fruit indicates that it is mature and that he can continue the drying process for selling.  The most difficult season is the winter since the rains flood certain parts of his farm and for this reason production lowers.

Victor is separated from his wife, with whom he has 2 children.  For the moment the younger lives with him and is studying the cutting of cloth/material and tailoring.  His other son is now older and independent.  The loan he is requesting will be for buying the land to be sown, seeds and sacks of feed.  He hopes to improve production and fix his home.

loans.use: land for sowing, seeds and sacks of feed

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es: Don Isidoro es casado, es pequeño productor de su comunidad, donde se caracteriza por ser muy responsable y trabajador, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hermanos en la produccion de la finca, esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de comprar vacas paridas y asi incrementar su inventario ganadero.
texts.en: Isidro is married; he’s a small producer in his community where he's noted for being responsible and hardworking.  His brothers help him with the farm work.  He’s asking for his second loan in order to buy recently-delivered cows to increase his herd size.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Marlon Raul

texts.es: Marlon es una persona trabajadora y responsable, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside en la Aldea Las Piñuelas, Comunidad de Catacamas. Marlon inicio su negocio desde hace 4 años, el se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva frijoles y maíz, cuando comenzó a sembrar tenia poca experiencia en los cultivos pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo y ahora tiene mucha experiencia en realizar las cosechas, el trabaja en conjunto con sus empleados. La ventaja es cuando el clima favorece a la siembra entonces obtiene una muy buena cosecha, los problemas que enfrenta Marlon son las plagas en sus cultivos y que en ocasiones la lluvia es poca y sus cultivos se secan. El préstamo que Marlon solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de urea, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. Con la ayuda de este préstamo tendrá la facilidad de poder tener mejores cultivos y que su cosecha sea de calidad y muy productiva. Sus sueños es poder sembrar en mayor escala y que su producción sea fértil. Marlon ha tenido dos financiamientos con FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Marlon, 25, is a hardworking, responsible person.  He’s single and lives in the village of Las Piñuelas in the community of Catacamas.  Marlon started his business four years ago.  He works in agriculture growing beans and corn.  When he started planting he had little experience with crops but gradually learned and now he has much experience in this field.  He works alongside his employees.  The advantage is that when the weather is favorable he gets very good harvests.  The problems Marlon faces, however, are infestations in his crops and sometimes rain is scarce and the crops dry up.

The loan Marlon is requesting is needed to buy urea, fertilizer and to pay labor costs.  With help from this loan it will be easier for him to have better crops and that his harvest will be of quality and more productive.  His dream is to be able to plant in larger scale and that his production is fertile.  Marlon has had two FAMA loans and he’s made his installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Al-Lith Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Lith and consists of four members: Noriah, Noha, Nadiah and Huda, who are ladies who are working hard to offer better lives to their families. They took a loan of 140,000 Yemen Rials (YER).
 
Noriah is 48 years old. She is married woman and has six children. She lives in Sana`a, Yemen. (She is the woman whose face is not covered). She sells clothing goods. She started her business one year ago to sell around her area since she enjoys the clothing trade, especially the sale of ladies clothes. 

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB so that she can invest in the acquisition of new clothes products such as skirts, shirts, pants and other products that are necessary for her customers. This loan will help her make a new investment so that she can generate more income and keep her customers satisfied. 

Her aspiration is to excel in a trade like incenses and perfumes and to have her own business in a location where there is more customer traffic.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as skirts, shirts, pants and other products that are necessary for her customers

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus tres hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de La Unión, Leticia.
Hace más de 25 años que trabaja en la agricultura, es la actividad con la que sustentó a su familia durante este tiempo, junto a su pareja. Produce hortalizas como: zanahorias, arvejas, habas, maíz, lechugas, coliflor, etc. “Siembro de todo, pero más rentable es la espinaca, la arveja y la coliflor”, menciona. Le agrada los días de cosecha, porque ve reflejado todo su esfuerzo en los productos saludables que obtiene. María decidió arrendar una parcela de terreno donde sembrará más arvejas y habas, porque la temporada de arvejas inició y no quiere quedarse atrás. Sus ventas la realiza en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, para ello tiene que llevar sus productos en camiones, a media hora de viaje más o menos.

Este es su crédito número 7 con MFP. Como en ocasiones anteriores, menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa de La Unión Leticia” y se siente a gusto de tener socias responsables en su grupo.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de bolsas de abono para fertilizar sus sembríos de arvejas.
texts.en:
María, 44, lives with her partner and father of her children in her own house located in La Unión District, Leticia.

She’s worked in agriculture alongside her partner for more than 25 years; it’s the activity that’s supported her family all this time.  She grows vegetables like carrots, peas, lima beans, corn, lettuce, cauliflower, etc.  “I grow everything but spinach, peas and cauliflower are the most profitable,” she mentions.  She likes harvest days because she sees all her effort reflected in the healthy products she obtains.  

María decided to lease a parcel of land where she will plant more peas and lima beans because the pea season has started and she doesn’t want to fall behind.  She makes her sales in the city’s wholesale market and to do so has to transport her products in trucks, a trip that takes half an hour more or less.

This is her 7th MFP loan.  Like in previous occasions, she mentions that she will be very punctual with her monthly installment payments.  She belongs to the “Santa Rosa de La Unión Leticia” communal bank and feels good about having responsible members in her group.

She will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of manure to fertilize her pea crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Agathe Vivitin

texts.fr: Agathe Vivitin est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. Tous vont à l'école et elle a 01 personne supplémentaire à charge. Elle vend des pagnes et des mèches depuis quelques années. Agathe Vivitin s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes. Agathe Vivitin veut s'acheter des pagnes et des mèches. Agathe Vivitin avec ses économies veut renforcer son fonds de commerce et surtout subvenir au besoins de ses enfants .
texts.en:
Agathe Vivitin is married with four children aged 3 to 9 who all go to school. She also supports another person. She has been selling pagnes and hair extensions for a few years. She buys her stock at a local market. Her customers are men and women. 

Agathe Vivitin wants to stock up on pagnes and hair extensions. She will bolster her savings, strengthen her working capital and provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of hair extensions and 7 pagnes VLISCO.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía tiene 57 años, es viuda, tiene siete hijos, pero solo vive con su hija de 30 años y dos nietos, en una casa que su esposo construyó en el distrito frío de Huaricolca.
Se dedica a las labores del campo; a la agricultura y ganadería. En sus terrenos propios produce arvejas, papas, habas, avena y alfalfa; y cría ovejas y cuyes. “Tengo como 120 cuyes más o menos, y los vendo a compradores que llegan hasta mi casa”, menciona. Rosalía se dedica a la crianza de cuyes hace 4 años y le va bien, cada cuy lo vende de 15 a 18 soles, dependiendo del tamaño. Les tiene un cariño especial a sus roedores, por eso los atiende con mucho esmero, en la limpieza de sus corrales, en el alimento balanceado y en la prevención de enfermedades. Ella considera que el lugar donde tiene a sus cuyes no es adecuado, porque los pequeños animalitos se mezclan entre hembras, machos y pequeños, por eso ahora piensa construir un galpón donde los podrá distribuir adecuadamente.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, siente gran aprecio por la entidad y por el apoyo brindado en todos estos años (cerca de 5). Da su palabra, una vez más, de pagar con responsabilidad las cuotas mensuales.
Invertirá este dinero en la compra de palos y mallas para la construcción de un galpón para sus cuyes. Además pagará a las personas que realizarán la labor.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 57, and a widow. She has seven children, but only lives with her 30-year-old daughter, in a house her husband built in the the cold district of Huaricolca.

She farms and raises livestock. On her own land she grows peas, potatoes, lima beans, oats and alfalfa, and also raises sheep and guinea pigs. “I have around 120 guinea pigs, more or less, and I sell them to buyers who come to my house,” she comments. 

Rosalía has been raising guinea pigs for four years and it is going well. She sells each guinea pig for from 15 to 18 soles, depending on size. She has a special affection for her rodents. That is why she takes great care in looking after them, cleaning their pens, providing balanced feed and preventing diseases. 

She considers that the place where she keeps her guinea pigs is inadequate, because the small baby animals are mixed with the females, males and small ones. That is why she now intends to build a shed where she will be able to distribute them properly.

This is her 11th loan with MFP and she greatly appreciates the organization for the support it has offered all these years (around five). She gives her word, once again, that she will be responsible in paying the monthly installments.

She will use this money to buy wood and wire mesh, in order to build a shed for her guinea pigs. In addition, she will pay the people who will carry out the work.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a new shed for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina tiene 25 años, su pareja es Lorenzo, con quien tiene tres hijos de 8, 6 y 3 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa.
Tiene cinco cuadras de terreno donde siembra café y plátano. El café le brinda ingresos una vez al año en casi tres meses, mientras que el plátano, cada quince días; por eso no le falta dinero cada vez que quiere pagar sus deudas o cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Rufina es joven pero de carácter fuerte, cada vez que tiene que ir hacia sus terrenos, lo hace con convicción porque sabe que gracias a su empeño podrá tener ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Para abarcar el cuidado de sus cinco parcelas tiene que contratar personal para la limpieza de la maleza. Por eso la mayor inversión es para el pago a los jornaleros. Ella y su esposo saben que con esfuerzo podrán adquirir otros terrenos y expandir su producción, esa es su meta.

Este es el crédito número 5 que reciben de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shatzoshis”, del que se siente a gusto por tener socios responsables.
Con este dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abono para el café y podrá pagar a los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de la maleza.
texts.en:
Rufina is 25 years old; her partner is Lorenzo with whom she has three children who are 8, 6 and 3 years old.  They all live in their own house located in an indigenous community.

She has five cuadras [1 cuadra=1.5 hectare approx.] of land where she grows coffee and bananas.  The coffee produces income once a year in about three months while the bananas do so every fifteen days.  This is why she never lacks money each time she has to pay her debts or cover basic needs.

Rufina is young but strong-willed.  Each time she has to head out to her fields she does so with conviction because she knows that it’s thanks to her efforts that she’ll have income to improve her family’s quality of life.  

In order to care for her five fields she must hire day laborers to do the weeding which is why her largest expenditure is day laborer salary costs.  She and her husband know that with effort they’ll be able to acquire more land and expand production; this is her goal.

This is MFP loan #5 and she commits to be punctual with the installment payments.  She belongs to the “Shatzoshis” communal bank and feels good for having responsible members.  With this loan she’ll be able to buy manure for the coffee and will be able to pay the day laborers who will clear weeds from her crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro tiene 34 años, su pareja es Alexander, con quien tiene una hija de 13 años. Juntos viven en la casa que ellos mismos construyeron en el distrito de La Unión, Leticia.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura, siembra diversos vegetales como arvejas, zanahorias y habas en tierras de su propiedad y otras que arrienda. Todos los días se hace cargo de vigilar sus cultivos, por eso sale de madrugada hacia sus terrenos que se ubican a varios minutos caminando. Le gusta el trabajo del campo y sabe cómo hacerlo bien. Es una mujer emprendedora porque también cuenta con animales que vende después de engordarlos, así obtiene ingresos extras para solventar sus principales gastos. Ahora tiene planeado, para el futuro, sembrar en mayor cantidad para aumentar su producción y así obtener mayores ganancias.

Este es su crédito número 9 con MFP y está segura de ser responsable y puntual en cada pago. Además manifiesta que está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque sus socias son organizadas.
Con el dinero de este préstamo invertirá en la compra de una bolsa de semillas de arvejas, cuyo precio es de 550 a 600 soles por bolsa de 25 kilos.
texts.en:
Milagro, age 34, and her life partner, Alexander, have a 13 year old daughter.  They live together in a house that they built themselves in the La Unión district, Leticia.

She is a farmer.  She grows various vegetables like peas, carrots, and beans.  She cultivates her own land, and she rents other land.  Every day she takes charge of looking after her crops.  That is why she leaves at dawn and heads for her land, which is a several minute walk for her.

She likes the farm work, and she knows how to do it well.  She is an enterprising woman because she also has animals that she sells after fattening them.  This is how she gets extra income to pay for their main expenses.

She is now planning to grow in greater quantity in the future.  She will do this in order to increase production and get greater income.  Also, she says that she is very satisfied with the work of her communal bank because the members are very organized. 

She will use the loan to buy a bag of pea seeds, which costs between 550 to 600 soles for a 25 kilo bag.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Willman

texts.es:
Willman tiene 34 años, su pareja es María, con quien tiene cinco hijos. Su casa es humilde pero propia, él la construyó con mucho esfuerzo y se ubica en una comunidad nativa.
A su edad ya cuenta con cuatro parcelas de café que sembró hace más de 10 años. Gracias a su empeño y dedicación pudo adquirir otros terrenos donde cultiva plátano, kión y a veces maíz. Pero señala al café como el producto que más satisfacciones le brinda, por su demanda y por la buena calidad que cosecha, gracias a los buenos suelos de su localidad y sus cuidados. “En el campo se invierte mucho dinero, en abono, semillas, pago de personal, pero también se gana bien”, comenta. Una de sus metas es ampliar su producción de plátanos y kión, ya que también le dan buenas ganancias, pero también tendrá que invertir en arriendo de terrenos. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por eso se siente agradecido por el apoyo brindado. Pertenece al banco comunal “Stonkiri de San Pablo”, donde siente identificación por ser un grupo sólido.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la siembra de kión; comprará semillas y abono, además de pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para estas labores.
texts.en:
William is 34-years-old; his partner is María and they have five children.  His house is humble but it’s his.  He built it with much effort and it’s located in an indigenous community.

At his age he already owns four parcels of coffee he planted more than ten years ago.  Thanks to this effort and dedication he was able to acquire other land where he grows bananas, ginger and sometimes corn.  But he stresses that coffee is the crop that gives him the most satisfaction because of its demand and the good quality of his harvest due to the good soil in his location and to the care he gives.  “Much money is invested in the fields for manure, seeds, to pay labor costs; but much is gained too,” he comments.  One of his goals is to expand banana and ginger production because they too produce good profits but he’ll need to invest in leasing land.

This is his second MFP loan so he feels grateful for the support provided.  He belongs to the “Stonkiri de San Pablo” communal bank where he feels noted for being a solid group.  He will use the money from this loan for his ginger crop; he will buy seeds and manure and will also pay for day laborers he’ll hire for these tasks.

loans.use: to buy seed, farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es:
Emerson tiene 33 años, su pareja es Delia, con quien tiene tres hijos de 11, 7 y 3 años. Todos viven en la casa que él construyó con mucho cariño para su familia, ubicada en una comunidad nativa.
Hace 15 años que ya trabaja en el campo, por eso sabe cómo debe cuidar y cultivar sus productos. Gracias a los padres de su esposa y a los suyos, ahora cuenta con 10 parcelas de terrenos de cultivo, donde siembra café, plátanos, achiote, yuca y maíz. Pero prioriza el cultivo de café y achiote por los buenos ingresos que le genera. Por la variedad de sus cultivos puede estar seguro que no le faltará dinero en cualquier fecha del año. Ahora está pendiente de la limpieza de su cafetal, porque la maleza está impidiendo su crecimiento normal, así también está terminando de cosechar los últimos granos de café.

Este es el crédito número 5 que recibe de MFP y confía en que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis” del que se siente contento por el trabajo en grupo.
Invertirá este dinero en la compra de bolsas de abono y en el pago de los operarios que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Emerson is 33-years-old; his partner is Delia with whom he has three children who are 11, 7 and 3 years of age.  They all live in their house that he built for his family with much love; it’s located in an indigenous community.

He’s been working in the fields for 15 years so he knows how to care for and grow his crops.  Thanks to his and his wife’s parents he now has 10 parcels of farmland where he grows coffee, bananas, annatto, manioc and corn but his priority is coffee and annatto because of the good income they generate.  Because of the variety of crops he can be sure that he’ll always have money available throughout the year.  He’s now careful to weed his coffee plantation because weeds are keeping it from growing properly and he’s also harvesting the last of the coffee beans.

This is the 5th loan he’s gotten from MFP and he’s sure that he will make his monthly installment payments punctually.  He belongs to the “Shantzoshis” communal bank where he feels happy with the teamwork.  He will use the money to buy sacks of manure and to pay the day laborers he’ll hire to do the weeding.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay for day laborers to work in his fields.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de six enfants dont deux vont encore à l'école, Justine vend de l'huile, des boites de conserve, des bazins et d'autres articles depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans certains marchés du Bénin. Sa clientèle large et variée est composée des béninois et des nigérians. En vue d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Le présent crédit lui permettra d'acheter des cartons de lait, de sucre, d'huile et de la sardine. Justine avec ses économies veut participer à la formation professionnelle de ses enfants et épargner.
texts.en: Married and the mother of six children, two of whom are still in school, Justine has been selling oil, canned food, traditional damask-type “bazin” wax  fabric and other items for a number of years. She stocks up at certain markets of Benin. Her customer base is large and diverse, composed of people from Benin and Nigeria. In order to increase her sales volume  and meet customer demand, she has requested and obtained a microloan from Finadev. The current loan will allow her to buy boxes of milk, sugar, oil, and sardines. Thanks to her savings, Justine would like to contribute to the cost of professional education for her children, as well as to put some money aside.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of milk, five boxes of sugar, five boxes of oil, and eight sets of traditional wax fabric.

loans.name: Seguno

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 50 años, su pareja es Mery, con quien tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Alto Incariado.
Él tiene más de 30 años en la agricultura, en todo este tiempo logró conseguir cuatro cuadras de terrenos de cultivo donde siembra café y plátanos. En dos de sus cuadras produce café, del que cosechar como 30 ó 35 sacos, y cuando los negocia obtiene buenas ganancias. Gracias al apoyo de jornaleros que contrata para el trabajo puede atender a tiempo sus cultivos y tenerlos listos para los meses de cosecha. A la vez, cuenta con una pequeña bodega, de cuyas ventas obtiene ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Ahora espera ampliar su producción, con la compra de nuevas plantas de café y bolsas de abono.

Este es el crédito número 5 que recibe de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, del que se siente satisfecho por el trabajo en equipo.
Destinará el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus tierras, y un pequeño porcentaje para adquirir mercadería para su bodega.
texts.en:
Segundo, age 50, and his life partner, Mery, have two children, ages 12 and 8.  They live together in their own house in Alto Incariado, a native community.

He has been farming for over 30 years.  In all of this time he has managed to get four “cuadras” [one cuadra = 6,400 square meters] of farmland where he grows coffee and bananas.  He produces coffee on two of the cuadras, and from that he harvests about 30 or 35 sacks.  He gets good income when he sells them.  Thanks to the help from the day workers he hires for the work, he is able to tend to his crops in a timely manner and have them ready for the harvest months.

He also has a small grocery store.  From this business he gets income to cover their basic necessities.  He now hopes to expand his production by purchasing new coffee plants and fertilizer.

This is his fifth loan from MFP.  He pledges to be punctual with his monthly payments.  He belongs to the Shantzoshis communal bank, and he is pleased by the team work.

He will use this loan to buy bags of organic fertilizer for his land.  He will use a small percentage to get merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his crops and merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 25 años, tiene tres hijos de 7, 4 y 3 años. Juntos viven en una casa rústica que ella construyó en la comunidad nativa Alto Incariado.
Cuenta con dos parcelas y media de terrenos donde realiza la actividad que más domina y la que le gusta hacer, la agricultura, siembra café y plátanos. “El cultivo de café es tedioso, todos los meses tenemos que limpiar de la mala yerba y pagamos a personal para eso”, menciona.
Gladys invierte tiempo y dinero en sus cultivos de café, pero lo hace con gusto porque sabe que en las cosechas verá reflejado todo su esfuerzo. Mientras tanto, se sustenta con la venta de sus plátanos, ya que los cosecha cada quince días. Es consciente que su producción es poca, pero por eso piensa ampliar sus sembríos con más café. Para eso arrendará otras tierras.

Este es el crédito número 5 que recibe de MFP por lo que se responsabiliza en pagar las cuotas con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, donde sus socios son personas solidarias.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de su cafetal que está infestado de arbustos y malezas.
texts.en:
Gladys is 25-years-old and has three children who are 7, 4 and 3 years of age.  They live together in a rustic house she built in the community of Alto Incariado.

She has two and a half parcels of land where she does the work she does best and enjoys the most: agriculture.  She grows coffee and bananas.  “Growing coffee is tedious because we have to remove noxious weeds every month and we have to pay laborers to do this,” she mentions.

Gladys invests time and money into her coffee crops but she does so gladly because she knows that all her efforts will be reflected in her harvests.  
Meantime, she supports herself with the sale of her bananas since they are harvested every fifteen days.  She’s conscious of the fact that her production is small which is why she plans to expand her coffee plantation.  To do so, she’ll lease more land.

This is the 5th loan she gets from MFP so she commits to make her payments punctually.  She belongs to the “Shantzoshis” communal bank whose members are supportive people.  With money from this loan she’ll be able to pay the day laborers she’ll hire to clear her coffee fields that are overgrown with bushes and weeds.

loans.use: to pay day laborers to work in her fields.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 28 años es un joven soltero y sin hijos. Vive solo en una casita rústica que construyó en medio de sus terrenos de cultivos en la comunidad nativa Alto Incariado.
Se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con tres parcelas de terreno donde tiene cultivado café. “Si salgo de mi comunidad tengo que dejar bien atendidos mis cultivos, por eso siempre contrato personal para que me ayude”, menciona. De sus tres parcelas obtiene como 50 sacos de café, los que vende en los meses de mayo, junio y julio. Mientras tanto, viaja a otra ciudad, a casi dos horas de su comunidad, donde trabaja en un taller de mecánico reparando autos y camionetas. Miguel no quiere descuidar sus cultivos porque siente a su comunidad como algo preciado, por eso continuará en sus labores.

Este es el préstamo número 5 que recibe de MFP. Menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, un grupo responsable y solidario.
Invertirá este dinero en el mantenimiento de sus terrenos de cultivos, para eso pagará a los operarios que necesite.
texts.en:
Miguel is 28-years-old, single and has no children.  He lives alone in a rustic house he built in the middle of his fields in the indigenous community of Alto Incariado.

He works in agriculture.  He has three parcels of land where he grows coffee.  “If I leave my community I have to leave my plants in good hands which is why I always hire personnel to help me,” he mentions.  He yields about 50 sacks of coffee from his three parcels that he sells in the months of May, June and July.  Meantime, he travels to another city that’s almost two hours away from his community where he works in an auto mechanic shop repairing cars and trucks.  Miguel does not want to neglect his crops because he considers his community as something to cherish which is why he will continue with his work.

This is the 5th loan he’s gotten from MFP.  He mentions that he will be punctual with his installment payments.  He belongs to the “Shantzoshis” communal bank, a responsible, supportive group.  He will use the money to provide crop care and to pay for the day laborers he might need.

loans.use: to pay day laborers that will work in his fields.

loans.name: Muath Group

texts.en:
This group is called Muath and its members are Munirh, Ghniah, Saba and Huda, all women living in Sana`a, Yemen.

Saba (the tallest woman in the photo) is a 34-year-old married mother of four children and the owner of her own business. She is requesting a loan of 40000 YER from AMB to buy materials such as needles and strings for sewing shoes, since competition has affected her sales a great deal and she needs more merchandise to offer her clients. She hopes to increase both her clientele and her income.

She also hopes to open a shoe store to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials such as needles and strings for her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 51 años, su pareja es Arminda, aún no tiene hijos. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa.
Santos es un hombre alegre y trabajador, lleva cerca de 30 años en las labores agrícolas, empezó con una parcela de terreno y ahora posee cuatro, en donde produce café, yuca y plátanos. “De mis terrenos obtengo como 80 sacos de café en la cosecha y lo vendo a 120 soles cada uno”, comenta. Uno de sus problemas en todos sus años de agricultor era la falta de capital, por eso dice que poco a poco se puede lograr muchas cosas. A pesar de las enfermedades que azotan sus cultivos, él muestra buena cara y afronta este tipo de problemas con sabiduría. Anhela sembrar más café, por eso tiene planeado cortar las plantas de café viejas y replantar unas pequeñas, para garantizar una mejor producción de los granos.

Este es el quinto crédito que recibe de MFP, por eso se compromete a pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, un grupo sólido y organizado.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de herramientas para el desyerbado de sus cultivos y para comprar bolsas de abono.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old. His wife is Arminda, and they have no children. They live in their own house located in a Native American community.

Santos is a cheerful man and a hard-worker, with almost 30 years of experience in agriculture. He started with just one plot of land and now has four, where he grows coffee, yuca, and plantains. "From my land, I obtain about 80 sacks of coffee in a harvest and I sell them form 120 soles (Peruvian currency) each," he says. One of his problems in all his years as a farmer has been the lack of capital, and because of this he says that he has been able to achieve many things little by little. In spite of the illnesses that afflict his plants, he puts on a smile and faces these kinds of problems with wisdom. He longs to plant more coffee, and because of this he has plans to cut the old coffee plants and replant some small ones, in order to guarantee a better bean production.

This is the fifth credit that he receives from MFP, because of this he promises to pay his monthly payments on time. He belongs to the community bank "Shantzoshis", a solid and organized group.

He will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of tools for removing his plants and to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy tools to clean up his plants and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lua`a Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs calls themselves “Lua`a.” There are three members, Aisha, Faizh and Lua`a, who know each other and are neighbors from Aden, Yemen.

Among the members is Faizh, 31 years old (in the center of the photo) and a wife and mother of four children. She started her business selling Incense at home more than six years ago and the result has been very favorable. Now she sells clothes and electrical materials. In fact, it is more favorable than she’d imagined. This motivated her to commit to this group of enterprising women to acquire a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB that will allow her to buy clothes and electrical materials to increase the amount of merchandise she has on sale at present. She trusts that this investment will continue producing dividends and benefits that will lead to a better quality of life for her.

loans.use: to buy clothes and electrical materials for her business

loans.name: Ayad's Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ayad and consists of four members Ayad, Ashwag, Eyman and Samah who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER.

Ayad is 31 years old, married, and lives with her three children in Aden, Yemen. She is the woman who is carrying a purple handbag. She has a house. She has had the business for over 10 years and for some time the house has needed some improvements. She needs to buy materials for repairs but has no capital, so she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to allow her to purchase wood, cement, etc.

loans.use: to allow her to purchase wood, cement, etc. for her business

loans.name: Alfiha Group

texts.en:
Alfiha's group is comprised of three hardworking women Raedh, Ghadh, Laila and one man Elyas. They live in Aden, Yemen. Raedh is 43 years old and lives in Aden, Yemen. She is married and has four children. 

For the past 20 years, Raedh has been working hard to manage her small hairdressing business. She is the woman standing in the center of the photo.

To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to buy cosmetic materials like combs, makeup, etc to sell and will help her to generate greater profits and earn money for her business. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a big beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic materials like combs, makeup, etc to sell

loans.name: Al-Ekhlass Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ekhlass and consists of four women: Rogyh, Amnh, Zain and Ameerh who are hardworking ladies. They took a loan of 200,000 YER. 
 
Rogyh is 55 years old and a loving mother of seven children. She is the woman who is standing in the photo.  She has tried to work hard. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. 

Due to the high costs of commodities, she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER to buy bedroom supplies like blankets, cushions, etc. In the future, she plans to send all of her children to school. She also hopes to buy furniture supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy bedroom supplies like blankets, cushions, etc. for her business

loans.name: Altareq Group

texts.en:
This group is called Altareq which is made up of 4 members: Ashwag, Fatima, Haind and Zainb, all of whom live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. 

Fatima is a 48-year-old married woman with 4 children and they live in Sana`a, Yemen. (She is the second woman from the left side.) She is working hard to cover her family`s expenses. That is why she is requesting the loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy bricks, cement and sand to renew her house.  She has several children and she wants to make them more comfortable.

Fatima’s dream is to have more income and to improve the construction of her house which will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand for her house.

loans.name: Yassr

texts.en:
Yassr, who is 36 years old, is married and has 2 children. He lives with them in Ibb, Yemen. His business is a small chicken store where he sells chickens for his clients.

He is requesting the amount of 100,000 YER to purchase more chickens. This purchase will generate greater sales in his business, and therefore Yassr's income will be better, and his customers will find everything in one place. 

Yassr's dream is the idea of expanding his business even more, and, when that happens, opening a phone accessories shop.

loans.use: to purchase chickens for his business

loans.name: Delfa

texts.es:
Delfa tiene 39 años, está casada con Denis, con quien tiene tres hijos de 16, 10 y 2 años de edad. Juntos viven en su casa propia construida en la comunidad nativa de Alto Incariado.
Ella es una mujer empeñosa, cuenta con cinco parcelas de terreno que la comunidad le brindó, allí produce café, plátanos y achiote. “De mis cuadras de café cosecho como 25 sacos y sin abono”, menciona. Por eso está vez piensa invertir en la compra de abono para producir en mayor cantidad. Sus cosechas las vende en las cooperativas de su ciudad, mientas que el plátano y achiote lo expende a compradores del mismo mercado mayorista. Con la ayuda de su esposo y otros operarios que contrata puede atender a todos sus cultivos y así obtener buenos frutos. 

Este es el quinto crédito que obtiene de MFP, por eso muestra seguridad al decir que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, un grupo unido y sólido.
Con este dinero podrá comprar bolsas de abono, pagará al personal que contratará para el apoyo en el trabajo de la poda y sembrío de nuevas plantitas de café.
texts.en:
Delfa is 39 years old, and is married to Denis with whom she has 3 children, aged 16, 10 and 2. They all live together in their own home, which is located in their home community of Alto Incariado. She is a tenacious woman who has 5 plots of land, granted to her by the community, where she produces coffee, bananas and annatto. "I get 25 sacks of coffee beans from my plot without using fertilizers", she tells us. Consequently, this time she wishes to invest in buying fertilizers in order to increase her production. She sells these harvests in her community cooperatives, whereas the bananas and annattos she sells to buyers in the same wholesale market. With help from her husband and other contracted workers, she is able to tend to all of her crops and, as such, she reaps good rewards.
This is her fifth loan with MFP, which shows her to be a solid borrower who will fulfill her repayment schedule punctually. She belongs to the "Shantzoshis" Communal Bank, a strong and united group.
With this loan she will be able to buy bags of fertilizers, and she will pay her contracted workers for the support they provide in pruning and sowing the new coffee plants.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to pay the day workers that work on her plots.

loans.name: Abdulhamid

texts.en:
Abdulhamid is a 42-year-old man. He is married and has 7 children; almost all of them attend school.

He has been working as a seller of groceries since 2008. He has received a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB for the purchase of general food products for his grocery store. He wants open a bookshop. He wants to become a wholesaler and provide a bright future to his family.

loans.use: purchase general food products for his grocery business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 46 years old and a married man who has 8 children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He emigrated from KSA (Saudi Arabia), where he was working in a business store. The main benefit being that he will succeed in starting his activity once again and that he will consequently be able to earn money for his family, on top of continuing working, something he likes very much. He sells clothes. 

He is a very hardworking and resourceful man, as he always looks for ways to earn money in order to help paying for his family’s expenses. He applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes like shirts and pants, etc. for his business. He hopes to buy a car and a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes like shirts and pants, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo, taken in the store.

Fatema is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to five sons and two daughters. Her two daughters are married and three of her sons are school students. Her husband and two of her sons are employed with low salaries, which are not enough to cover the family's needs and pay the education expenses. 

For the past month, Fatema has been selling clothes. Still, she needs to improve her project and get more support to cover the store's costs. She is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of summer clothes to resell. This will enable her to compete with others and attract new customers to buy from her store. That will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of summer clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ramdan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ramdan and consists of three women: Fawziah, Susan and Muna. They live in Aden, Yemen. They took out a loan of 150,000 YER.

Susan is 45 years old, married and has five children. She is the woman who has her face covered in the photo. She lives with them in Aden, Yemen. She sells many businesses like perfumes, incense, etc.  She is focused on her business because this is a great help in improving their economic conditions. As time passes and her customers' needs grow, she doubles her seriousness. But seriousness and hard work aren't enough. 

As a result, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy perfumes, clothes, etc as additional commodities to sell. She hopes to gain more profits through these goods in order to be able to provide a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, clothes, etc for her business

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta sua mãe enviando alguma ajuda para alimentação. 	
É militar e quadro do Ministério da Defesa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (aros para portas, areia, cimento, pedra, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja crescer de categoria, concluir e mobilara a casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é terminar a sua obra, vedar e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en: Marcelino is the father of 2 children who go to school.  He lives in his own home and also supports his mother by sending her money for food.  He is a member of the military in the Ministry of Defense.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (door frames, sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.) to keep working on his home.  In the future, he hopes to rise in rank and to finish and furnish his home.  To do this, he promises to pay off his loan on time to be able to request more from Hluvuku.  His challenge is to finish his home and to seal it to offer better comfort to his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (door frames, sand, cement, stone, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 49 years old, married, and lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has eight children. To help cover household expenses, he started repairing fridges 30 years ago. He is professional in this field. His main difficulty is the slump in attracting more clients, so he asked for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy spare parts for his repair business. In the future, he wants to expand his business and, if possible, add another secondary business to ensure the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his refrigerator repair business.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 39-year-old housewife caring for four children. She is helping her husband, who is serving in the military, by supporting the family financially from the business she has, which is animal sales.

She has a small barn beside her house that holds sheep and goats. She uses some of them to sell milk and others for animal sales itself. She has applied for this loan to do some enhancements to the barn and get more food for the animals.

loans.use: to do some enhancements to the barn.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en: Sultan is a 21-year-old single guy, and he is the oldest among four other siblings. He is a university student majoring in finance and banking. He has applied for this loan in order to pay for his upcoming semester fees. After he gets his bachelor degree he hopes to apply for a masters degree in the same field.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam, who appears in the photo pictured next to her vehicle, is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to seven daughters. Three of her daughters are university students. Khitam's husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay the education expenses.

For the past three years, Khitam's husband has also been selling plastic products like plates and cups from a stall he has. That has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover the costs.

Khitam wants to live in better conditions with her family, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her complete the price of purchasing a new vehicle. This will facilitate the movement of Khitam and her family from one place to another and help Khitam's husband to carry the plastic products to his stall, which will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing a vehicle.

loans.name: Rosa Melania

texts.es: Rosa vive en Duran en el barrio conocido como Los Helechos. Ahí tiene una casa propia de cemento que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, pocos barrios de su sector cuentan con alcantarillado y camino pavimentado. A sus 27 años está casada con Ángel con quien tiene 2 hijos de etapa escolar. En su domicilio Rosa tiene un taller de costura el cual empezó hace un año con la ayuda de su esposo. El oficio lo aprendió hace 10 años por que su madre ejercía esta profesión la cual le gusto mucho, como su esposo era empleado en una empresa ella le ayudaba con los gastos recibiendo costuras y realizando arreglos cuando sus clientes lo solicitaban. Fue cuando su esposo dejo el trabajo que equiparon un poco el taller, con la liquidación compraron una maquinas industriales y ambos se dedicaron a obtener resultados. Ahora tiene varias personas empleadas que realizan la confección ya que sus principales cliente son pequeñas empresas y vendedores locales. Comenta que como vive en un sector donde las calles no están asfaltadas su principal problema es la transportación y el costo que tiene. Con el préstamo va a comprar otra máquina industrial y telas para la confección.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Duran in the suburb know as Los Helechos. She has her own house built of cement which has light and running water. Few neighbourhoods in her area have sewerage systems or paved streets.

At 27 years of age, she is married to Angel, with whom she has 2 school age children. 

At home, Rosa has a sewing workshop, which she started with her husband's help. She learnt the job 10 years ago because her mother was in this profession and enjoyed it. As her husband was employed by a business she helped with their expenses by taking in clothes for repairs when her customers requested it.

It was when her husband left work that they began to equip the workshop, with the settlement they bought some industrial machines and both worked hard to achieve results. Now, she has various employees who do the sewing as her main customers are small businesses and local sales people. 

She comments that, as she lives in an area where the roads are not paved, her main difficulty is transportation and its cost. 

With the loan she is going to buy another industrial machine and fabrics for sewing.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 30 años, su pareja es Roxana, con quien tiene tres hijos de 5 y 3 años y un bebé de 8 meses. 
Él tiene tres cuadras de terrenos de cultivo donde siembra café y algo de plátanos. Tiene buenas plantas de café que le botan granos desde enero hasta mayo, todo gracias a los cuidados que les brinda. “Les echo abono, les corto la maleza, limpio sus hojas de las arañeras”, menciona. El plátano que cosecha le ayuda en los gastos diarios, pues cosecha dos veces al mes. Él sabe que con mucho esfuerzo puede adquirir otros terrenos y ampliar su producción, por eso se esmera todos los días en sus cultivos. Actualmente cosecha de 30 a 35 sacos de café, pero anhela llegar a los 50, es una de sus metas. 

Este es el quinto crédito que recibe de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, un grupo sólido y organizado.
Con este dinero podrá pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus terrenos. Además comprará víveres y alimentos para preparar la comida de los trabajadores.
texts.en:
Wilder is 30-year-old and his partner is Roxana and he has three children with her: an eight-month-old baby and a five and three-year-old.

He has three blocks of land parcels under cultivation where he grows coffee and some bananas.  He has good coffee plants that put out coffee berries from January until May thanks to his care for the plants.  “I give them fertilizer, I prune them, I clean the leaves of spider webs and pests,” he tells us.  He harvests bananas twice a month.  He knows that with great effort he can acquire more land parcels and expand his production, this is why he takes great pains to care for his plantings every day.  He is currently harvesting 30 to 35 sacks of coffee but he hopes to get to 50, this is one of his goals.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he commits to making punctual monthly payments.  He belongs to the communal bank “Shanzoshis,” a solid and organized group.

With this money he will pay the workers that he hires to clear his land.  He will also buy supplies and food to prepare meals for his workers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who work on his land.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa, a 28-year-old single conservative lady, asked her only brother to take her place in the photo.

Using her first loan has helped her bring more food products to the store, which helped her to get more clients. Now she has applied for this youth loan in order to increase the quantity of goods she has in the store.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods she has in the store.

loans.name: Onelia

texts.es:
Onelia tiene 37 años, está casada con Liborio, con quien tiene tres hijos de 17, 11 y 6 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 20 años, desde que unió su vida a la de su esposo. Cuenta con tres cuadras de terrenos de cultivos donde produce café y algo de plátanos. Acaba de plantar café en una cuarta parte de parcela la que estará lista para las cosechas dentro de 3 años, para ello, Onelia debe cuidar con esmero sus plantaciones. A la vez, tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que instaló en su vivienda, así abastece de víveres a los comuneros de su zona. Ella quiere seguir creciendo, tanto con la agricultura y con en su bodega, por eso no duda en seguir esforzándose.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis”, del que siente identificación por ser un grupo solidario.
Con este dinero podrá pagar al personal que contratará para la limpieza de su cafetal que quedó débil después de la última cosecha.
texts.en:
Onelia is 37 years old and is married to Liborio, with whom she has 3 children aged 17, 11 and 6. They all live together in their own home, located in a native community. She has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years ever since she married her husband. She has 3 plots of cultivable land where she grows coffee and some bananas. She has just planted coffee on a fourth plot which will be ready to harvest in 3 years and, as such, Onelia must show great care in looking after her plants. At the same time, she also has a little grocery shop, which she has set up in her home, from where she supplies groceries to the people in her neighborhood. She wishes to keep on growing her business, as much in agriculture as in her shop, and without a doubt she will continue to strive for this.
This will be her fifth loan with MFP, so she gives her word that she will be punctual in fulfilling her monthly repayment schedule. She belongs to the "Shantzoshis" Communal Bank, which is known for being a united group. With this money, she will be able to pay the works that she will contract to clear her coffee plantation which has been weakened by the last harvest.

loans.use: To pay the workers who clear her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya, a 25-year-old conservative married lady, asked her brother to be shown in the photo instead.

Raya wants to support her brother in continuing his higher education to get his Masters degree, so for that she has applied for this educational loan to pay for his registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's registration fees.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 40-year-old married man with five children.  He and his family  live in Ibb, Yemen.

For the past four years, he has owned and operated an auto body repair shop, and he has a good reputation among customers. The project is a profitable one, but he needs more support to cover the costs of operation.

He is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy a generator and make some necessary repairs. This will increase his business efficiency and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to buy generator for his repair business

loans.name: Abdulrzaq

texts.en:
Abdulrzaq is 41 years old, and he works hard to support his family. He is married and has a bus transportation business in Taiz, Yemen.

He requested a loan of 100,000 YER through AMB to buy tools and equipment for his bus.

In the future, he would like to save enough money so he could afford to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for his bus

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil, a 33-year-old resident of Sana`a, Yemen, is the father of one child, still in school. Khalil has owned a taxi for three years, having purchased it with savings and money lent by his relatives.

Khalil is now requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi. He believes the additional income from this loan will help him to provide a better education for his child.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Saron is 27 years old. She is single and resides with her sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her sister have been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $7 per day. Saron wants to rebuild her house. With this goal in mind, Saron is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop of her own to generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: Sopheak is 23 years old. She is married and resides with her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a chef for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is employed as a sale representative and h earns about $4 per day. Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Sopheak is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Rogerio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 3 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta sua irmã que vive com ele. 	
Trabalha como controlador de tráfego local, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (portas, aros para portas, janelas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja casar-se oficialmente, concluir e mobilara a casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é terminar a sua obra devido ao elevado custo de material.
texts.en: Rogerio is married and the father of five children, three of whom are in school.  He lives in his own home and also supports his sister, who lives with him.  He works as a local traffic controller.  With his current loan, he will buy construction materials (doors, door frames, windows, etc.) to continue work on his home.  In the future, he hopes to obtain his marriage license and to finish and furnish his home.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is finishing his home due to the elevated prices of materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (doors, door frames, windows, etc.).

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 31 years old and married with two children. He operates a spare parts shop to earn a living. In the beginning, he had a car and then he sold it to open a spare parts for car decoration business. He has one employee. He is taking a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase necessary spare parts like stereos, cover wheels, etc, which has helped to grow his business. He hopes to expand his business to increase his profit income.

loans.use: to purchase necessary spare parts like stereo, cover wheels, etc for his business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 35 años, es soltero y hace 7 años que decidió vivir solo y construir una casita rústica en medio de los terrenos que la comunidad y sus padres le otorgaron. Eduardo se dedica a la agricultura, siembra café y plátanos. Para vender sus productos tiene que recorrer una hora de viaje para llevarlos a la zona donde encuentra transporte para llevarlos a la ciudad. “Es rentable la venta de café, por eso cuido con más esfuerzo el cafetal”, menciona. Eduardo ofrece sus granos de café a las cooperativas de su zona, por eso no pierde. Una de sus metas es mejorar su producción de café, para ello comprará más plantitas y bolsas de abono.

Este es el crédito número 5 que recibe de MFP, da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Shantzoshis” y menciona que le agrada el trabajo con socios responsables.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en el pago de los operarios que contrató para la cosecha de café y para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 35 years old, he is single and 7 years ago decided to live alone and build a country cottage in the midst of the land that the community and his parents gave to him. 

Eduardo works in agriculture and sows coffee and bananas. In order to sell his products he has to travel for an hour to take them to the area where there is transport to carry them to the city. "The sale of coffee is very profitable, because of this I have put the most effort into the coffee plantation" he mentions.

Eduardo offers his coffee grains to the local co-ops, because of which he doesn't lose out. One of his goals is to improve the production of coffee, for which he must buy more plants and bags of manure.

This is the 5th loan that he will receive from MFP, he gives his word to be punctual in his monthly payments. He belongs to the communal bank "Shantzoshis" and mentions that he is grateful to work with responsible members.

He will invest the money from this loan in paying the labourers that he hired to sow the coffee and to clean his crops.

loans.use: to pay the labourers who work on his land.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos destes 3 ainda frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua família. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos alimentares diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, açúcar, feijão, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja desenvolver mais o seu negócio introduzindo outros produtos, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo segundo o calendário para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é dependência financeira e a saturação do mercado.
texts.en:
A married mother of 5 children, of which 3 are still at school, the borrower lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else besides.
She has her own business selling a range of food products, and with this loan she hopes to buy products (nuts, sugar, beans, oil and other items) to increase her stock level.
In the future she hopes to develop her business further by introducing new products, and as such she promises to punctually fulfill her repayment schedule so that she can apply again to Hluvuku.
The challenges that she faces are financial dependency and saturation of the market.

loans.use: To buy and sell products (peanuts, sugar, beans, oil and other items).

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is 32 years old, married, and a father of three children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He owns a house which he is currently in the process of furnishing, so as to be able to provide furniture for his family. 

To this end, he needs support from AMB from which he requested a loan of 280,000 YER. With it, he will purchase furniture like blankets and cushions as well as carpets. He takes care of his family, providing food and paying the bills. Currently, his only concern is to complete construction and to be in a stable situation.

loans.use: to purchase furniture like blankets and cushions as well as carpets.

loans.name: Acacio

texts.pt:
Viúvo e pai de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É militar e quadro do Ministério da Defesa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (janelas, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa, subir de categoria para aumentar o seu salário, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir um meio de transporte para melhorar as condições de deslocação para o seu serviço.
texts.en: Acacio is a window and the father of one son who goes to school.  He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone else.  He is a member of the military and the Ministy of Defense.  With his current loan, he will buy construction materials (windows, cement, sand, stone, etc.) to continue working on his home.  In the future, he hopes to finish his home and to rise in rank to increase his salary.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is acquiring a means of transportation to improve his home's conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (windows, cement, sand, stone, etc.) to continue work on his home.

loans.name: Santo Marlene

texts.es: Doña Santos tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos adolecentes los cuales estan estudiando.  Tiene mas de 20 años de tener su propio negocio de pulperia donde ofrece a sus clientes productos para el consumo diario en el hogar.  Esta solicitando es financiamiento con el objetivo de fortalecer su inventario comprando granos, ropita de bebé y otras cositas que su clientela le solicita.
texts.en: Santos is 42 years old, she is married and has two teenage children who are both studying. She has had her own business, a small grocery store, for more than 20 years. She offers her customers products that are used on a daily basis in the home.
