She joined MCDT to get more capital for her business. She would like to expand her business and begin selling wholesale. She lives in her husband`s house, which has access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia tiene 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superación. Su pareja es Guzmar, quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es el padre de sus dos hijos: Susana de 7 años y Carlos de 5 meses. 	

Su actividad es la preparación y venta de especerías y condimentos, lo que aprendió de su madre. Elabora deliciosos preparados para guisos y demás comidas. Todo lo preparan en casa y los vende en un puesto del mercado de su localidad. Comenzó hace 4 años con un préstamo particular, vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades, y en la actualidad ve que su negocio ha logrado crecer, por lo que lo considera rentable. Le agrada su trabajo, pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja a solventar los gastos de sus hijos menores, además de tener una ocupación, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida por la oportunidad brindada de tener una línea de crédito para alcanzar sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría de sus miembros y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus especerías, como condimentos y verduras. También adquirirá algunos abarrotes para surtir su puesto.
texts.en:
Rogelia, 28, is a hard-working woman who is determined to get ahead.  Her husband, Guzmar, works in civil construction and is the father of her two children, Susana, 7, and Carlos, 5 months.

She prepares and sells spices and condiments, a trade she learned from her mother.  She makes delicious prepared items for stews and other meals.  She makes it all at home and sells it at a stall in her local market.  She started four years ago with a personal loan, and sold in small quantities.  Now she has been able to grow her business into something she believes is profitable.  She enjoys her work since she can earn her own income and help her husband cover their minor children's expenses.  It allows her to stay busy, since she was unable to finish her education.

This is her third loan through the MFP institution and she is grateful for the opportunity to have this line of credit to reach her goals.  She is happy in her communal bank because she knows most of the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive.

She plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy ingredients for her spice business, such as condiments and vegetables.  She will also buy groceries for her stand.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food and condiments.

loans.name: Msanide

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Msanide. He is married and has a 7-year-old son who is in grade one. Msanide has just completed a training with Mobile Transactions to start running his own mobile money transfers shop.

Msanide is excited to start running his own business because he sees this as a way for him and his family to be empowered. He says the profits he will be getting from his business will help him provide for his family.

When he gets the loan, Msanide will be able to start his business by paying rent for his shop, buying two phones to use for transactions, and procuring some T-shirts and stationery.

He is hopeful that once he gets the Kiva loan, he will be able to start to save up enough money to see his son through college.

In the Video, a representative from Mobile Transactions interviews Msanide.

loans.use: To pay rent for his shop, buy two phones, some T-shirts, and stationery.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard  is a 38-year-old single man. He describes himself to be a principled man. He operates a retail store where he sells gas cylinders. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy business area and his primary customers are the general public.

Benard describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of gas. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more gas cylinders and pay for refilling them with gas. His business goal is to run a big shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy more gas cylinders and pay for refilling the cylinders with gas.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy tiene 19 años, es un hombre amable y emprendedor con ganas de superación. Es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su tía en compañía de sus tres primos.
Su actividad es la venta de carne de res, compra la carne en el camal municipal a los ganaderos y la vende en un puesto del mercado. Se inicio hace más de 4 años por idea de su tía, quien le enseño todo sobre el negocio, comprando en pequeñas cantidades que luego fue aumentando viendo la demanda. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, logrando tener una buena acogida y siendo muy conocido en el mercado. Antes de empezar tuvo dificultades económicas, ya que los gastos que tiene debe solventarlos solo y debe pagar sus estudios universitarios.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente agradecido con por la oportunidad de continuar con su negocio, además desea seguir contando con más créditos. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. 
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de tres cabezas de ganado, cada uno valorizado en 900 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Freddy, 19, is a kind, enterprising man who is determined to get ahead.  He is single and has no children, and lives with three cousins in his aunt's home.

He sells beef which he buys at the municipal abbatoir from farmers, then sells at his stand in the market.  He started the business four years ago, encouraged by his aunt who taught him everything he knows.  At first he sold small quantities and then increased according to demand.  He believes business is considerably profitable, based on his earnings, and he has been able to establish himself in the market where he is well-known.  Before starting the business he had economic difficulties because he pays his own expenses and must pay for his university education.

This is his third loan through the MFP institution and he is grateful for the opportunity to continue his business.  He also wants to be able to request more loans, and is committed to paying them back on time.  He plans to use the 2,500 PEN loan to buy three heads of cattle, each worth 900 PEN.

loans.use: To buy three cows to sell beef.
